Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Verlisia
Reviews.Content: This holiday is (or was?) actually Beverly Garland. It still has its boutique hotel feel that sets it apart from a standard Holiday Inn Express. Stayed here for 2 nights on the weekend for a short trip. The location is good if you need a place near Hollywood Bowl, Universal Studios, Hollywood Walk of Fame and many other North Hollywood attractions. They have shuttle service, free wi-fi, on property restaurant, pool, spa and many other standard amenities. No problem with the service. Check in was easy and the staff was courteous and efficient. Room was quite small. You really don't get a lot of space to roam around but they do have a nice cozy balcony. The bed and pillows were reasonably comfortable. Because of the location right next to the highway, the room could get noisy. I didn't have trouble falling asleep but I suspect some might. Try to get a room facing away from the highway if you get bothered by constant background noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to Universal Studios and Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: svwyo5150
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spring break in California and stayed 3 nights at this hotel. Nice location within a mile from Universal and they provide a free shuttle that runs every hour in the morning and every 15 minutes in the evening. The staff was very helpful and the room was clean. I would recommend a room on the pool side however if you want to avoid traffic noise from the freeway. We ate breakfast every morning at Tula's, which was good and kids 12 and under eat free. We also had a couple dinners there, which were also tasty with great service. Only complaint is the parking fee, which is $15 per night. We did receive $3 off of that because we are Holiday Inn Priority Club members; however, still don't like the fact we had to pay for parking. Overall, its a nice hotel in a great location to be able to do Universal Studios or any other studio tour, as well as Hollywood Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced”
Reviews.Author: Car25
Reviews.Content: This is an ok hotel but I think it's over priced for what you get. They charge too much for parking and there is always a lot of kids running around and the rooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “holiday”
Reviews.Author: arthur63-ardie
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our stay, our room was below ground no view. that is if you get a king size bed in a Standard room only this one floor . our girls had a double beds it was better, their side they could see. the rooms were kept clean. i found all the staff to be friendly and very helpful. the only complaint the conceige recommend a tour guide that was no good at all. the rest of what was recommend was good. the evenings the food was great mornings not so much, prices scary. location was great. fridge and parking you pay extra. no safe in the room, but safety deposit boxes small private room by front desk. I found their security very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: lindymck07
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Beverly Garland in March 12. The hotel is very comfortable- which is just as well as the weather was miserable! Tula's is great for breakfast but not so great for other meals as the food is very "boutique" - great tasting but not a lot of it! However, if you've got great weather, you'll be out and about during the day anyway. The hotel is in a great location for Universal Studios and offers a great shuttle service to the Metro station to further explore Hollywood and LA. We were not overly taken by LA as a whole, more a state of mind than an actual place, but we really enjoyed our stay at the Beverly Garland.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Steve F
Reviews.Content: Super helpful and friendly staff, great location, super clean hotel, free shuttle to Universal Studios...what else can you ask for? The only bad part was breakfast at the adjoining restaurant...not good.

Reviews.Title: “Our group loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsCleanX
Reviews.Content: Everyone loved this hotel. The pool area was great for the kids. The grounds are very nice and the hotel has a unique vibe that we adored. The parking was easy and spacious. It's a good location for doing things in the area. The restaurant on site is pretty good too. The only thing that would have made it better was a mini fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GSusan
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Excellent Staff. Excellent dining room and wait staff. Wonderful pool area. Fun gift shop. Comfortable beds and rooms. Everything you could want and good price too. And the possibility of tv show filming while you are there! (Parks and Rec when we were there!!)

Reviews.Title: “Plaisantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: louise_girouard
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay very much. the staff was very friendly and helpful. our room was confortable clean and quiet. especially loved the fireplace in the lobby and by the pool. We asked for 2 double beds and it was no problem.

Reviews.Title: “What a terrific Retro Holiday Inn!”
Reviews.Author: DierksLizzie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there recently...what a pleasant surprise! Being a Baby Boomer, and a child of the 60s Holiday Inns were where we stayed often. Yes, the beds are new and furniture too but the atmosphere was so cool! Service was greater than great, and food was one of the best restaurant's in Hollywood, really! Try it; you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: CACDJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, clean, comfortable and priced right. The staff was polite and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: sham-TRIP
Reviews.Content: What a brilliant stay, excellent location, a hotel that offers a free shuttle bus through out the day to universal studios and also other excursions that are reasonable priced. The staff herer gave me and my husband outstanding service and were so friendly and made us feel so welcome. Next door to the hotel is a restaurant-tulisa, we ate here once and the food was yummy and again reasonably priced. cannot fault this hotel, clean spacious rooms with comfy beds, iron, ironing board, hairdryer etc. Highly recommended would stay again, bargain! :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay By 2 Aussies!”
Reviews.Author: scorpiolee
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Beverly Garland after 7 wonderful nights in Las Vegas and were a little concerned that after Las Vegas, this hotel would be disappointing - but we were wrong! We checked in after a very hairy and scary drive from LAX (our first time driving in USA!) and the staff who checked us in were so lovely - giving us directions to the local supermarket and advising us of all the amenities available to us at the hotel. We were given room 222 in the El Dorado building and when we opened the door, I was pleasantly surprised. This hotel has to be at least 40 years old yet our room was spotlessly clean. I used to be a housekeeper years ago and always look for the faults of cleaners in hotels and this room had none. The bathroom, though a little weary, was so clean and sparkling. We used the free shuttle to Universal Studio's the following day and it is a very short 5-8 minute ride and they drop you right at the door and let you know when they will be back (on the hour - every hour). We went back to meet our driver and there he was - right on time! What a great service. As all the rooms and balconies are smoke free, we used the area downstairs a lot which was really pretty with tables, chairs and big gas heaters. We went down the road to the local Ralph's supermarket each afternoon and bought our alcohol supplies and filled up one of our garbage bins in the room with ice (from the free ice machines on every 2nd floor) and sat around the courtyard having a few drinks and that was no problem at all. I approached the front desk to ask if they supplied shower hats, and they gave me one of every sort they had (3 in total). Nothing seemed too much trouble for the staff here at all. My husband used the pool and jacuzzi but it was a little too cool for my liking to go swimming in February and they had a lovely fireplace burning in the pool area - very cosy! We used their onsite laundry - $3.00 for a full load of washing and $3.00 for a full load of drying and that was very handy after being away for 2 weeks! We also ate in the restaurant Tula's - a little on the pricey side but the food was very good. For a hotel of this age, it is extremely well kept and looked after and we would not hesitate in returning if we are in Los Angeles again. A very nice 4 nights was had by us both.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Los Angeles, CA”
Reviews.Author: iscream4life
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to LA to visit his sister and see the city. We got a good deal off of Travelocity. When we first got there we were upset that we booked what we thought was a king executive room and it turned out not to be what we thought we booked. It wasn't Beverly Garland's fault but Travelocity since there was a difference in the wording. The staff at this hotel offered us to stay in the suite we wanted for a good deal (it would have cost us alot more to upgrade). They kept insisting they wanted us to be happy. The room was beautiful and very large. I must say they have very honest housekeeping staff. I put out money for a tip and they didn't touch it. I finally had to put a note that said "Tip" for them to take it. The pool wasn't heated but the whirlpool was nice. They have generous pool hours. This isn't a Holiday in express so no free breakfast. Tula's was a bit expensive but we just went there for coffee and dessert. The dessert and coffee was amazing!! The hotel is located right by the freeway and a block away from Studio City. My sister in law said that is where all the celebrities tend to live or hang out. There is a free shuttle to take you to Universal Studio City Walk. Parking is about $15 a night but the front staff asked if we wanted to sign up for their Holiday Inn reward card and got $3 off of parking a night just for signing up. The beds are comfortable and we had a delightful time staying there. We would stay again the next time we are in LA.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars for this excellent and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: 81Simon7
Reviews.Content: with the friendly and efficient staff getting all our praise following a recent family stay of 2 weeks. We found that nothing was too much trouble and always in a most gracious manner. The hotel is only 4 minutes walk from supermarkets, restaurants and a small mall and 5 minutes in the free shuttle bus to Universal Studios where you are dropped outside the actual entrance so no extra walking and the Metro from where Hollywood etc is only a 10 minute ride. It felt like going home after a full day out especially and unusually being situated in large grounds and not being a high rise modern monster. A heated pool out of season for the kids a bonus and a laundry room cutting down those extra costs. You would not know that you were staying in a Holiday Inn affiliate !!!

Reviews.Title: “Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: MMLA46
Reviews.Content: Recently updated this hotel has excellent facilities and the service is very good. The pool area is very nice. The location is excellent for Universal and the Metro to get you into the centre of town. There is a free shuttle to both from the hotel and back as often as you want. It is worth upgrading your room to overlook the pool ...this also counteracts some of the noise from the only negative that I can find about this hotel which is from the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Good value, polite and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: JamesSwansea
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business. The front desk staff were very helpful and courteous. The room was spacious and clean with a massiveTV and loads of plug sockets. The free wifi is very quick. There are plenty of spaces in the carpark. This hotel is fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Average Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: MBWest6
Reviews.Content: We were visiting LA for a B'nai Mitvah and the celebration was being held at this property. The property was clean and surprisingly quiet, considering we were so close to the freeway. The pool area was relaxing and the staff was kind, honest and very friendly. I left a pair of earrings and a bracelet in my room and was delighted to hear from their Executive Housekeeper, Rosanna, that they had found both. It was a wonderful ending to a lovely stay at the Beverly Garland!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeff V
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel has been around for several years, it is updated and in a great location near all the major studios. I found this property even better than the Beverly Hills Crown Plaza which is typically the crown jewel of the Holiday Inn chain! I didn't realize until I left that the hotel was once owned by actress Beverly Garland (My Three Sons) and her husband which adds a little Hollywood history.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: California-Girl-00
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to Universal Studios. Also close to where you can watch tv shows filmed. When we visit this are we always stay here. Very clean, friendly and helpful staff, everything you would expect at a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice restaurant and bar - LA style - 2 minutes drive to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: VooDooTravelPro
Reviews.Content: We all loved this property on our recent road trip. Nice pool, nice room, clean - all recently updated - nothing looked tired. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “unique, surprising hotel”
Reviews.Author: adenacb
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for a few nights, wanting a place close to Hollywood. We were pleasantly surprised by the Beverly Garland. Although it's a Holiday Inn, it is very unique. It is quite a large property, and the rooms were large and very well-appointed. The beds were so comfortable! There is a nice pool area and jacuzzi, and the onsite restaurant was excellent. The staff was warm, friendly, and helpful. It is located very close to Universal, and also to Hollywood and all the sites. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Night”
Reviews.Author: RyanB2011
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding reception and wedding night at the BG Holiday Inn. Had a great time and enjoyed fantastic service. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel close to universal”
Reviews.Author: justjude10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a kids suite which suited us perfectly. Can't complain about anything, staff were great and our rooms were ready at 9am which was fantastic after a long flight. Loved the pool, enjoyed many a cocktail there whilst using free wireless. Free shuttle to the metro and univesal is a big plus. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: CountessCeprano
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for only one night in February 2012. This is not your average Holiday Inn. Grounds are beautiful, particularly the pool area, which has an outdoor fireplace and upholstered furniture. Staff were very welcoming and helpful. Room was immaculately clean. This is an older hotel, but the bathroom was very well maintained ... not even a hint of mildew stain in the shower/tub's tile grout. Negatives would be the airconditioning unit ... one of those you control via a console near the window (kind of noisy) and freeway noise, but freeway noise isn't the hotel's fault; I usually travel with earplugs, anyway. Mattress was firm and comfortable and linens were very good. Coffeemaker in the room was nice, too. Oh, and there were plenty of electrical outlets. There was even a power strip by the bed so you could plug in your laptop. And the free wifi was terrific. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: carspot
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed here in mid December 2011. The hotel was decorated beautifully for Xmas and it smelt delicious. The room was really comfortable & clean and all the amenities and grounds were excellent. The staff were all very nice and helpful. We found the location was great as public transport was so close. Bus stop is across the road and train (metro) a short walk or shuttle ride. Hotel restaurant was convenient and food was good, but you could also walk 5 minutes down the road to a little shopping centre where there were a few eateries and a grocery store (Ralphs) if you preferred. This is a great hotel and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel & staff!”
Reviews.Author: Erin K
Reviews.Content: Bghi was awesome, staff were so nice, names Karla and Anna! The restaurant was beautiful and staff was so lovely! We stayed at bghi for 12 nights! Close to everything! Beautiful & clean, worth every dollar! We are from Australia and we felt at home! Shuttle bus was very good and driver was very nice! So many good things! Stay here!!!!!!!! We will be back! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Room & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: myupdate
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was quite pleasant and talked us into upgrading our room for an additional $30 a night. The upgrade was worth it...our 2 1/2 year old loved the bunk beds, insisted on eating at the desk in her alcove, stored her toys in the chest of drawers, and was mesmerized by her own personal giant TV! The step stool in the bathroom was a nice touch and made it easy for her to wash her hands all by herselft too. Ralph's Grocery Store is within walking distance so we kept snacks in our fridge. Our only two complaints: the gift shop was supposed to open daily at 9AM (we're Diet Coke drinkers & the soda machines were out hence the need for the gift shop) and the two times we showed up at 9AM it wasn't open yet and the bar didn't open until 4:30 so you could only get beer and wine in the restaurant. No liquor until 4:30. :-( We could hear the highway noise, but got used to it after the first night; however, it was very loud with the patio door open.The pool area was really nice and I'm assuming it was heated because we often saw people swimming day and night. We had one of the best hamburgers and chicken sandwiches we've ever eaten at the hotel's restaurant! If you want church on Sunday that's not a problem because there's a non-denominational service that congregates on Sunday. Overall this is great value and has all the amenities and then some you would expect at a 4 star hotel! Would definitely recommend and stay here again; however, I hope we don't visit LA again any time soon because the traffice was TERRIBLE!

Reviews.Title: “Bit dated & Noisy”
Reviews.Author: James_Titirangi
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed to this hotel, well not really welcomed, but came to this hotel with our booking not in the system (this was paid for a good 3-4 months earlier) and had to wait some time while the manager was called in to allocate us a room. We requested non-smoking (it's a non-smoking hotel apparently) and were subsequently given a room that smelt strongly of cigarettes. They have a $250 fine if they think you're the culprit so quickly called up the front desk and got moved a few rooms down, much better. The rooms themselves are old looking, old TV, no coffee/tea facilities. Main issue we had was that it was difficult to sleep due to the constant (loud) noise coming from the 101. We were on the top floor (7th or 9th I believe) and even with the doors closed could hear this all night long. With the door opened it was deafening - really wished they were double glazed! Location seems to be pretty good as it is so close to the freeway, and I get the feeling in LA you need to have a car unless you're not looking to go very far. Gave the hotel 3 stars (and not 2) mainly because we were only there for two nights prior to flying back home. Another positive is that the cleaning/maintenance staff were much more friendly than the front desk!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Avi186338
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 10 nights at this hotel. The rooms are great and clean, and the service is brilliant. In particular, Alex at the front desk was fantastic. He was always so willing to help, and helped me find the best deals on trips, and always gave the best advice. Thank you Alex!

Reviews.Title: “A good deal better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Gustypants
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with a Holiday Inn but some are better than others and this one is better than par. Firstly the location is great. It is a ten minute drive (even in LA traffic) to Universal Studios and Warner Brothers and 15 minutes gets you into the heart of Hollywood, there is even an hourly free shuttle from the hotel to Universal to make life easier. The hotel facilities, that you probably wont use, are also better than the norm with a good size pool and spa bath and gym. The restaurant is nothing to write home about but serves solid scran to keep the littl'uns happy. We stayed in a familly suite that was a good size and had a solid partition between a comfotable king bed and good sized bunk beds. The super rich don't stay here but you and I won't not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BEST HOLIDAY INN'S”
Reviews.Author: Andy B
Reviews.Content: My wife and son recently stayed for 3 night's here, whilst traveling in America. The level of friendly and attentive service was exceptional. All the staff just could'nt do enough and came across as very genuine. Not the have a nice day because it is part or the script! but that they wanted them to have a great day.

Reviews.Title: “Iconic a Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Millionmiletravelers
Reviews.Content: This is a throwback to bygone age in LA. Great location near Universal Studios and the Citywalk. Lots of great local restaurants and easy access to LA in general. The hotel is clean, well-taken care of, and the staff is the best in terms of being helpful, courteous, and willing to meet personal needs. Know that there are separate buildings for the rooms, but the garden areas make it a nice walk. While having the sliding door open allowed street noise in, with that door closed I did not notice much traffic sound at all in spite of the hotel's proximity to the freeway and busy local streets. You can't go wrong here for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Like coming home!”
Reviews.Author: cathleen720
Reviews.Content: After almost one year we returned to the Beverly Garland Hotel (Holiday Inn) for eight nights. As we drove onto the hotel's brick paved parking area, we were greeted at the lobby entrance by two incredible flaming heat lamps, twinkle lights in the trees and a welcoming fire burning in the lobby fireplace. The front desk staff were as friendly and efficient as ever and greeted us by name. They knew which room we wanted and had it ready immediately. Tula's, the hotel restaurant ,has undergone a miraculous change in it's decor and menu. The food was delicious and presented beautifully. It was warm enough to sit outside on the patio for breakfast and late in the evening at the bar. The hotel has a courtyard with little cabanas and the same type of flaming heat lamps that greeted us upon arrival . When we stayed before, the laundry facilities were not great, but they have changed the location and added two additional washers and dryers with lots of natural light and close to the pool.One night it rained and there were guests still in the pool and jacuzzi enjoying the pool area which has a lovely fireplace to sit beside and get warm. Our room was clean and well stocked with fluffy towels and the bed is one of the most comfortable.Our room attendant creatively arranged all our bathroom "stuff" and kept everything orderly during our stay. We really felt taken care of. The Pay Per View movies were not working one night, but that was OK because we had our iPads and WiFi was free! We can't recommend this hotel highly enough...it's our second home!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely area and wonderful Motel”
Reviews.Author: Jodky
Reviews.Content: We are an Australian family three adults and two kids (8 & 11) stayed in the family suite. Great area we felt very safe. The free shuttle took us straight to Universal Studios or to the subway you can go to Hollywood walk of fame. The rooms were very lovely and had an old hollywood feel to them. The pool really made us feel glamourous!!! Just a short walk up the road was a large Ralphs (grocery store). The room is a queen bed in the open living are and a half wall conceals the bunks (each area has their own tv). we stayed here on the way into USA and on the way out. Great value for money....would definately recomend to everyone not just families

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yorky85
Reviews.Content: We had a relaxing stay before cruising. The hotel staff were particularly helpful and friendly. We were not too impressed with LA, as we are not interested in films or impressed with 'celebrities' perhaps it is not too surprising. We did enjoy our stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for a stay in LA!”
Reviews.Author: sticks26
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during early December and it is a wonderful hotel and good location for staying within the Hollywood area. Our room was in the 'Portola' wing of the property and did not notice any traffic noise at night during our stay. The room itself was comfortable and welcoming and all the staff were very friendly and it was nice that our room was ready when we arrived at 12 noon after a 15 hour flight from Australia. Dined at 'Tula's' restaurant for both breakfast and dinner - can not fault the food at all - it is definitely worth eating here as some restaurants in America serve up fried, greasy and unappealing food. The location is really close to Universal Studios and the hotel offers a free shuttle service to and from the theme park. They will also drop you off at the Metro - it is only 1 stop on the metro red line to end up in downtown Hollywood! Lastly, when I left LA to travel up to San Francisco I had left my digital camera behind in the hotel room, I contacted the hotel and they FedEx'd my camera overnight to my hotel in San Francisco and in what was an extremely nice gesture took care of the delivery charges. When I return to LA I will definitely make this my base as the facilities and service is top class. The only issue that I found was a bit odd was the charge of $10 per day to gave a fridge in your room. I never had to worry about having a fridge as only stayed for a few days but in the summer months it might be useful to have. What is useful though is the free wifi throughout the hotel - just contact front desk for the password. Thanks again for a wonderful few days and hope to revisit the hotel again someday soon.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and calming”
Reviews.Author: jendasal
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely business visit to the Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn. It is full of Old Hollywood Charm and absolutely retains the California atmosphere that out-of-town travelers crave-- crisp, cool pool, cabana-filled courtyards, flowers and palm trees. The staff was quick with service, very friendly, and always happy to answer questions. My room was lovely and clean. Best of all, it is convenient to many LA freeways-- getting to downtown LA, Pasadena, and so forth is a snap (though traffic, of course, changes this a bit). I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Experience.”
Reviews.Author: 1951rlm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Nov '07. It was a short stay due to our crammed schedule, however, we are still pleased we chose to stay here and long for some time to return. If you are a traveller prepared to research the story behind this accommodation, and accept its age, then you must try this place. The staff were amazing. The restaurant and bar were First class. Even the shuttle service for Universal Studios and the Sightseeing tours was exemplary. Highly recommend the Beverly Garland.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: iowabeachmom
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel with very nice rooms. It appears that they have been recently updated. Staff were extremely welcoming. Parking was very convenient to room location. Pool area was nice with an outdoor fireplace. We didn't eat in the hotel but there was a restaurant that appeared to be nice. Stay at this hotel for proximity to great vacation hotspots without the huge pricetag.

Reviews.Title: “Second time just as good”
Reviews.Author: RealMagpie
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what happened me when I was booking our hotel for a recent short stay in Los Angeles but I was sure that I had booked a different hotel than the one I had stayed in before. Not for any reason only than the price and location were right. I was therefore delighted when our bus driver pulled into the Beverly Garland and I realised that it was the hotel I had stayed in on my last visit to L.A. in 2005. My experience of the hotel was very favourable on that occasion and I am delighted to say that it was just as good and as favourable this time around. Putting it simpley, this is a really nice hotel in a great location. It's only a few minutes drive from Universal Studios, which is a must see when in L.A. and the hotel runs a very regular free shuttle bus to and from Universal and they will also drop you to the nearby Metro train and bus station from where you can access all the main sightseeing locations for a couple of dollars as well as the city's main train and bus stations. The rooms are a nice size and really nice and the service is very good. The restaurant is very good too, especially the breakfasts of which the highlight is an all you can eat buffet for just $15. There is also a lovely pool and jacuzzi area and ample room to just chill out. All in all this is a great hotel with a great location and best of all it's well priced. Looking forward to my third visit in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Holiday Inn, BG, Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Steven F
Reviews.Content: Generally good experience with room for improvement. Good location with easy access to Universal Studios by shuttle bus. Room was very good, roomy and clean. We took a taxi up to the Big Boy Burger Bar which is a must-see Americana experience and really good fun. Hotel pool was good and busy. Staff were OK, but service felt a bit tired. My main concern was the chaos at breakfast and the constant muddle with the bills.

Reviews.Title: “Tough Reviewer, worth every cent.”
Reviews.Author: trickydickfromoz
Reviews.Content: We are tough reviewers from Perth, (two Adults and one 9 yo girl) from Western Australia on hotel stays, and we found the Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn value for money and provided everything we needed. We stayed from the 16th to the 19th of December 2010. I chose the location to visit Universal Studios and the Hollywood area. The hotel provides a free regular shuttle service to Universal studios and when needed a drop off and pickup at the North Hollywood Metro station. The room had two comfortable queen beds, provided laundry rooms and a pool and spa. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the hotel is ideally located to explore the area via car (which we didn't) or public transport. For our needs, the Beverly Garland ticked all the boxes. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Niels2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at y Garland's Holiday Inn on 4 and 5 September. The check in was fast (though there is not much space at the reception desk). Was given a map to show directions to the hotel room (you drive around back). There was ample parking space and I usually managed to park close to the hotel room and in the shade, as there is a lot of vegetation. The hotel has a nice atmosphere, with water themes and paths throughout. The room was average size and I especially enjoyed the terrace that looked out toward the courtyard containing tables and a bar for guests. The room is rather close to the highway but this did not bother me at all at night. Beds were good, and the flatscreen was nice. Free wifi in the rooms. All the staff at the hotel were very friendly and glad to help with advice when asked. Definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely 10 star!”
Reviews.Author: Bris12
Reviews.Content: Wow..knock your socks off customer service We got in early direct from Brisbane Australia and the front desk staff effortlessly found us an interim room as there was a large gap till check in due to a hiccup with booking. The staff were gracious,professional, efficient and discrete. The young room service chap was excellent (if you find the one who's twin brother plays chess) the bell hop chap was excellent and I absolutely loved how you felt like you were coming home each time you arrived back with the fireplace and the "welcome back" comment as you came in the door..I stayed with my wife and a 9 year old and 14 year old and found the service and location brilliant The pool was beautiful and food was great. My only suggestion is that the hotel needs to ensure there are not two menus in the room service which was confusing

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Universal Studios Park.”
Reviews.Author: Momcat55
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to SoCal and I was the official planner (party of 6 with two rooms). I scoured reviews and decided on this hotel due to the reasonable price and convenient location to Universal Studios. We were not disappointed. The grounds were very lushly landscaped (I'm partial to greenery) and the rooms were decent size and clean. Pool area is nice as was the fitness room . Staff was nice and friendly. The shuttle bus to the park operated frequently and we were delighted to get dropped off at the entrance with no parking fees or long walk. The only negative was the noise from the freeway, but overall, not that bad. Another thing we liked was the short walk to a main intersection featuring a food store, drug store and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Something sweet here”
Reviews.Author: mamajojoYork
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at the Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn - and so glad we returned. We first stayed here a couple of years ago, and revisited it in October 2011. The rooms aren't luxurious but are clean and spacious; the pool area isn't massive but has the lovely touch of big loungy couches and a huge open fire (and jacuzzi, of course). The on-site restaurant. Tula's has 'real' food (not all deep fried burgers!) and has a fairy-light strewn outdoor area, which sort of overlooks the entrance to the hotel (and hence the comings and goings of cars) - but... but... there's something kind of kooky and charming about this place. Conveniently located close to Universal Studios and the freeways, you do get a bit of traffic noise if you're put in the wrong rooms. And yet again, I would say, we love it here! Staff are friendly and helpful. If you go out of season you often get the pool area to yourself (and they don't observe stupid EU 'elf and safety rules on keeping the children out of the jaccuzzi) and they also turn a blind eye to you taking your own drinks to have by the pool as the poolside bar is closed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my sister-in-law on vacation. I was surprised by how lush the landscaping was. Perfectly groomed, the hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays. The staff, from the receptionist desk to housekeeping, was warm and pleasant. Beds were comfortable with your choice if soft and firm pillows. Tula's restaurant had a great breakfast buffet the morning we went. Again the staff was wonderful and the food was good and plentiful. The only negative thing I can say is that the bathroom was a bit small. There was limited vanity space for two women traveling together. I will not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Lovely All Around”
Reviews.Author: glen1nnes7hard1
Reviews.Content: Stylish throughout,and being Christmas,the courtyard area,pool etc were all alight with pretty fairy lights & a gigantic tree.The staff were friendly,as were the staff in Tulas.Our room was always cleaned thoroughly and coffee replenished every morning.Maria in the gift shop was spot on getting us directions using the metro to get to Citadel.The free shuttle was another plus and we also used it to get us to the metro station (saved us a 10 min walk) and Rite-Aid and Ralphs are just around the corner from the hotel.Thanx for making a couple of Kiwi's from G.I, Auckland happy!Talbot & McKee

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic price & hotel contributing to an amazing stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: s0phisticateddiner
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely with very attentive staff throughout. It had a beautiful pool area and shop on site. The rooms were very clean and spacious. There is a free shuttle service to Universal Studios, this was very handy and we utilised it a few times. For going into Beverly Hills we used the taxis which are on site ready to leave when you are. On one lazy night we ordered room service which was great service and nice food. Me and my partner were highly impressed for the price we paid and would of happily paid more.

Reviews.Title: “Love LA ...a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Bee C
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, it had a great feel at home feel. I love the staff so friendly and Terry in the boutique shop was so nice and lovely and i felt as if i had known her all my life. This hotel is in a great location, near the freeway and the shops. The parking was easy and the room was lovely so comfortable and clean and nice. I would stay here again and hope to someday.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: chatterbox21362
Reviews.Content: Stayed as a family at the end of november.great spacious rooms.brill location.excellent value. Nice touch.staff arranged helium balloons & gifts for our anniversary & hubbys birthday

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DeDe H
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over the weekend on my way up the coast. Fabulous, sophisticated feel to the property (bar, holiday decor, etc), but EASY to get to, easy to park, easy to deal with. Nice big open spaces. The staff makes you feel like a million bucks, the rooms are modern and newly decorated, and Tulas had a great breakfast. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patrick N
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel. Check-in was pretty smooth, the staff was very friendly, they provide a free shuttle ride to Universal Studios, and there's a small restaurant in the hotel. Most of the staff were Filipino, so my dad and my grandmother didn't have any problems communicating. There's a small fireplace in the lobby which is really neat especially if you plan on catching up with your reading. The rooms were pretty small though, one of the elevators wasn't working which wasn't really a big deal for us since we stayed at the first floor and there wasn't anything near the hotel besides a small restaurant called Tula's. There's not much negative things to say about this place for it's one of the best places I've been in. I really suggest staying here, especially if you're having problems going around.

Reviews.Title: “Newly remodeled suites are beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Katie N
Reviews.Content: I just stayed in one of the Beverly Garlard's new remodeled suites for a week and was quite impressed. The living area is roomy with comfortable couches to lounge on and watch TV. The high-speed internet was very reliable which is most important to me as a business traveler. The bed was very comfortable and the newly installed soundproof windows kept the room very quiet, even though it was facing the 101 freeway. I never heard the traffic! The staff was very friendly too. I highly recommend this hotel. It was conveniently located near enough to downtown to make it easy to get to but in North Hollywood enough to make it quaint.

Reviews.Title: “The Beverly Garland is the best!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara B
Reviews.Content: Wow! After getting through the busy LA traffic, we arrived at the Beverly Garland and immediately relaxed and felt at home. The staff is so friendly and the property has a relaxed, old-Hollywood feel. No stuffy high rise feel here - just an expansive property that includes a pool, restaurant, hip bar, exercise room and even a guest laundry! Everywhere we looked, people were relaxed and enjoying their experience. I also loved that the parking was right on property with plenty of safe, wide spaces. The location is so convenient to all the major LA touristy things. This is the second time we have been at the Beverly Garland and we continue to appreciate the effort of the staff in making our stay superb! We highly, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for visiting Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: metrochica
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week at the this gem of a hotel on my first visit to Los Angeles. I was very happy with my stay. It was a great base of operations for sightseeing. It really does look like an oasis stuck between the freeways and concrete of busy Los Angeles which is fantastic after navigating 405 traffic from LAX. Loved the trees, topiary and other nicely landscaped plants. The pool was lovely with its fireplace and comfy seating. The location is great very close to major roadways and a short shuttle ride to the Universal Studios metro. Just remember to tell the driver you'd like the metro. The shuttle goes back and forth from the hotel to Universal Studios but it will stop at the metro in between if you need it. The trick is to remember to call the hotel when you come back on the metro because the shuttle won't stop there automatically. It also appears that the shuttle won't pick you up from the metro unless its near the time it leaves on its normal cycle. So make sure to bring the schedule with you. I did have a rental car which is convenient in the sprawling mega city, but if i didn't have one it would have been easy to use the metro to get in and out of the city. The parking rate isn't too steep and if you are a priority club member you get a discount. I ate at Tula's restaurant twice during my stay. It was clean, had a great selection of dishes and very tasty. The waitstaff was a bit short staffed during my stay and it did take a while for them to notice you, however once they did they were very friendly. The rooms were very nice and large. I was on the 3rd floor in Portola. I didn't realize that the hotel is actually made up of two buildings with rooms behind a main building with a business center, front desk, lounge. There are several other structures on campus as well. The Ballroom, the theater, the pool and sauna and the restaurant, and tennis courts. It was a charming, old school set up that you don't see much with the mega hotels having everything in one massive structure. The one downside to the multiple buildings is it takes you a bit longer to get your key cards fixed if they deactivate during your stay. You actually park your car near your building so if the key doesn't work thanks to being too close to your cell phone you have a short walk back to the main building. Not a major problem and the hotel does have lots of ramps and well lit walkways. The room decoration was a bit Spartan but it was clean and everything worked and I plenty of space. It would have been big for a family of 4 as well. The one thing that does need upgrading are the bathrooms. Not sure if it was just my building. The bathroom was very clean just some of the fixtures appeared to date back to the1950s and were a bit tricky to turn on first go around. The beds were very comfortable and they give you the choice of hard or soft pillows which is always nice. The walls are not soundproof so I did have a few nights listening to the neighbors TV. But I did not here much traffic noise which was a great surprise. The Beverly Garland was a great base of operations if you are sightseeing. It was peaceful, clean and had a great location. I would definitely suggest friends and family stay there if they find themselves in the city of angels.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel as a base for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: RMS83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a great time. Hotel provides a free shuttle to Universal Studios which worked great for us since we were not driving. Hotel is clean and has a great restaurant which went out their way to cater to us (they stayed open even after the closing time as we checked it late and hadn't had dinner yet). The bar is just lovely with good music. Overall a good hotel but a littlle pricey.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in LA!”
Reviews.Author: Kim H
Reviews.Content: Loved the easy style of the Beverly Garland Hotel! Close to Bob Hope airport, wonderful bar and really good restaurant on site! The Christmas decorations were beautiful, the pool, spa and sauna are secluded in a central location with an outdoor fireplace and comfy couches to boot! Highly recommend this hotel to everyone - you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Beverly Garland!”
Reviews.Author: Susan K
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a girls' weekend and headed to LA from Oregon. We were fortunate to have picked the Beverly Garland Holiday Inn as our 'headquarters.' What a great hotel. It was just perfect. The rooms were clean and spacious. The pool, sauna and hot tub were a welcome sight. We had drinks at the bar one night and breakfast at the restaurant one morning. Everyone was friendly and helpful to us. We loved the festive decorations that put us in the spirit for the weekend. Great location. We'd recommend this as a place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Tami E
Reviews.Content: Went for a girlâ€™s weekend to Christmas shop and see the Christmas lights in the city. The holiday decorations at the hotel were beautiful! The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. The exercise room had more equipment than any hotel I have every said at. The restaurant and bar staff was awesome and the food was healthy and great. Wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fumes and noise from US101, cigarette stench and pubic hair!”
Reviews.Author: dolanspringsazlol
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how it is that anyone could rate this hotel 5 stars. The BG Holiday Inn is located basically on top of the US 101. Of course, this guarantees that there is a continuous roar of cars and trucks from all areas of the hotel. I stayed 1 night in a standard room. I was originally allocated a room on the fifth floor. This room had a delightful view of the freeway. However, more disturbingly the sliding glass door on the balcony would not close in this room. The room was therefore very loud and smelled of car fumes. After complaining, I was allocated a room on the second floor. Like a punch in the face, the second room smelled of cigarette smoke. It was, however, marginally more quiet than the old room so I settled for the better of the two evils. However, the noise was still loud enough to make it difficult to sleep. The beds were comfortable but the hotel in general was poorly maintained and the decor was extremely outdated. The furniture was old and tarnished. The room was very unclean. The carpets were stained, there was pubic hair all over the bathroom floor and the bath/shower drain was blocked causing the bath tub to fill up when the shower was turned on. The bathroom tiles were cracked and required an overhaul. While the hotel does provide a complimentary shuttle service to Universal Studios, the Hilton and Sheraton appear to be far newer than this hotel and are located at the park. It is possible for a low cost hotel to provide a decent experience, but I really couldn't wait to leave this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pay for guest car park!”
Reviews.Author: Jenski-Bob
Reviews.Content: Stay at this hotel for 2 nights. The rooms were fine and the pool and sauna were lovely. We had a hire car and we had to pay $15 a night to use the car park? Complimentary car parking should be the case saying as we are staying there? Staff at breakfast buffet were unhelpful. Asked for tomato sauce 4 times and im still waiting.. It wasnt even busy! Never mind, part from that it was ok!

Reviews.Title: “faulty Towers”
Reviews.Author: GeoffHowell
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 day package in the Beverly Garland for our Silver wedding, what a big mistake, after a 4 1/2 hour drive from vegas we arrived at the hotel being from the UK we expected booking in and going to our room, but that was not to be after 1 hour 10mins of the receptionist telling me he could see our resivation but they could not accept my credit card this after 3 hour was due to visa been down, so we endded up paying $270 deposit. We got to our room and tunrned on the heater as it was cold within 10 minutes the fron of the heater had fallen off i replaced it but throught the night it kept dropping off, i reported to one of the maids but no one came. We also had trouble with the lights turn them on but could not turn the wall lights off and wires were coming from the socket. The worst thing was the noise from the Interstate it kept us both awake all night, the next morning my wife wanted to go back to vegas but because we had booked to go to universal studios i asked her to give it a little longer but even after a trip to the studios she wanted to leave. The hotel was fairly clean but needs updating and taking out of the 70s. Would i stay here again.. never the only redeeming thing about the place was one of the front desk staff who helped us sort out the visa problem Anna i think her name was.

Reviews.Title: “A week too long”
Reviews.Author: Julie W
Reviews.Content: Booking hotel through an agent I had no idea it was going to be such a long drive to all the sight seeing tours. It was just to far out of town. I did not feel that safe to venture to far from the hotel. The room was clean and comfortable. Most of the staff were friendly and helpful. A week was way to long.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for 2 Nights”
Reviews.Author: gigidygigidygoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during our road trip. Nice hotel with friendly staff. Nice rooms, good location and comfy bed. The windows were single glazed so if you're a light sleeper its probably not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: caram30
Reviews.Content: I booked a last minute vacation through US Airways Vacations for 5 days in November, and the Beverly Garland was one of the hotel choices. After reading the positive reviews on Trip Advisor, I decided to book my stay here. I was not disappointed. My stay was perfect. I arrived about 3:00 p.m., and my check-in was very smooth. My room was very clean and spacious, and a haven to return to after busy days of sightseeing. The bed was extremely comfortable, and I always got a good night's sleep. Although the weather was a bit too cool for me to use the pool, it was so inviting, and the restaurant, Tula's, was very good. The hotel staff at the front desk were always very friendly and helpful, as were Terri, Barbara and Maria in the gift shop. There were safety deposit boxes available, as well as two computers for use in the business center and free WiFi throughout the hotel. I was taking the red eye home on my last day, and my luggage was safely stowed through the day so I could take advantage of all my last day exploring. As a single woman traveler, safety, comfort, and ease for getting to and from the sights of LA were very important to me. I felt very safe at this hotel, it was very comfortable, and unlike many reviews written before, I found that the location was great for getting to the sights. The hotel provides a free shuttle to and from Universal Studios and the Metro station, which are just a short drive down the road. The bus (#156) to the center of Hollywood (Hollywood and Highland) stops right across the street from the hotel, and returns to doorstep of the hotel. The concierge will provide you with the schedule both to and from town. I used this bus a great deal, and could not have asked for more. The ride is about 20 minutes and very few stops were made along the way. To me the ride did not seem overly long for public transportation. What a delight to get off the bus at the Kodak Center (right in the hub of the Hollywood attractions). My very first view was of the HOLLYWOOD sign from the Kodak Center! To be dropped at the door of the hotel on the return trip, especially when returning after dark, was such a positive! I used the hotel shuttle to go to the Metro to get to downtown LA to visit Olvera Street and the Los Angeles Historical district. It is a direct route on the red line to the last stop at Union Station. This line also stops at Hollywood & Highland, Hollywood & Vine, and a near the theaters in downtown LA. There is a free tour of the historic district that leaves from the office next to the fire station. Once downtown, the DASH bus is also available to visit the Walt Disney Concert Hall, the Staples Center, Little Tokyo, etc. Fare for the buses and the Metro is $1.50 one way or an all day $5.00 pass. I didn't use public transportation to go to the other places I visited, but am sure that with a bit of work, it was doable. One review stated how long it had taken using public transportation to get to Long Beach and Santa Monica. I rented a car for a day to go to the Getty Museum (definitely go here), Long Beach and Santa Monica (the pier at night is beautiful). The car rental price was reasonable, and great to be on my own schedule. Even with a car, the trip to Long Beach was about an hour and a half one way (although I did take a few wrong turns even with a GPS), so I figure 2 1/2 hours on a bus that another review stated it took, is probably par for the course. If you have a car and have the time, take Multiview Drive in Hollywood Hills (Muholland Drive) for bird's eye views of Universal City, the Hollywood Bowl, the Hollywood sign and downtown LA from the Scenic Overlooks. The Drive starts just a short distance from the hotel and winds up into the hills. I really enjoyed this short excursion. For my other exploring, I booked the Citysights LA Hop On, Hop Off bus - poor choice! I wish I had paid more attention to Krisrose's Trip Advisor review dated 9/11/2011 about this company - ditto to everything she stated!!! My booking did however include a Movie Stars Homes and Beverly Hills tour which I enjoyed. The hotel had recommended Starline Tours - perhaps this was the way to go. On my last day I visited Madame Tussaud's. The wax figures are incredible, and the museum is very interactive. It was so much fun! The hotel offered 2 days for 1 at Universal Studios (also available on-line). If you don't have or don't want to spend 2 days at Universal, you can purchase your Universal tickets at Madame Tussaud's and get entrance to the wax museum for free. For me, this was a great deal. I am a planner, and since I don't want to waste one minute while traveling, I like to have a good grasp of what I am doing and how to get there before I leave home. As stated in many reviews, LA is very spread out, and so planning was definitely much more challenging. Exploring LA in sections: Hollywood, Universal City area, Beverly Hills, Downtown LA, the beaches, etc. is the best way to go. Knowing how much time is needed for each attraction is also helpful in being realistic about how much you can not only see, but also, enjoy. I definitely recommend the Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn. It was a great place to stay, and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sportwife
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest Holiday Inns I have ever stayed in. Service was very good.....the front desk person Angela was the best! I would stay here anytime for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: us4travelers
Reviews.Content: We had a kids suite and our kids loved the bunk beds! The property itself is beautiful and well-maintained. The decor has an old Hollywood vibe yet it's contemporary & fresh. Our room had free wifi, microwave, fridge. From the moment we checked in til the moment we checked out, the staff was extremely friendly and accomodating to our family. We were grateful to Terri in the gift shop who is very knowledgeable about the area. During our stay we enjoyed the fitness room and pool area and ate many meals at Tula's. Sonia, our waitress at Tula's, was outstanding! The hotel is in close proximity to Universal Studios (there is free shuttle) and is fairly close drive to the ocean and other parts of Hollywood. It's a great family-friendly hotel without sacrificing luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & Safe”
Reviews.Author: Nan V
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and very friendly staff. Workout room was in good shape and well-maintained. Safe environment in middle of Studio City.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Universal Studios and Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for more nights than expected due to the Qantus air strikes! Our stay was extremely pleasant and we found the staff helpful and considerate. The room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. The swimming and jacuzzi were a pleasant accessory to the hotel. The hotel is very conveniently located for Universal Studios and the Metro train station. Both are a short 15 minute walk around the corner. The metro train will take you to Hollywood. We found the distances to the rest of the city very challenging. A trip to Santa Monica and Long Beach both took about 2 and half hours on the buses. The buses are easy to use but the city is massive! Supermarket and Starbucks round the corner are good for breakfast and other bits. The restaurant was pleasant and the staff very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sparkles89
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after receiving a great rate for 5 nights. At first I was a little worried about the location, I shouldn't have been worried at all! It is so easy to get to Hollywood, there is a subway or a bus stop right out front of the hotel! Facilities are great. There is a huge Ralph's food store a few blocks down. I'm really happy we stayed here and would recommend anyone stay here and make sure you visit universal studios!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Nnb
Reviews.Content: Very clean and staff were very friendly. The room was a good size with 2 Queen size beds. My only complaint is that the air con was very noisy and could do with updating. There was a free shuttle bus service to Universal or the Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Time for a decor refresh”
Reviews.Author: Xhand
Reviews.Content: Convenient for Universal with excellent staff and very clean. Rooms were as one would expect from HI, bedding was above average as were amenities. What the hotel could use is a refresh in the decor, the walk to the rooms is rather dark and dated. Dark wood accents and trim are predominant making what could be an A+ hotel a strong B.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great but too close to the freeway, we could hear the cars”
Reviews.Author: MelissaCOliveira
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, we were treated very well at the check in. We thought the room was great, we've got a view to the yard and pool, huge flat TV screen, the hotel was near Universal Studios (and they have free shuttles to the park in every half an hour). There is a comercial building very near the hotel, we walked to the supermarket, pharmacy, etc. And at the hotel they have Tula's with great food and service, room service and a great lounge. Everything was great but the noise... We could hear the noise from the freeway, even with the windows closed...

Reviews.Title: “Better than most Holiday Inn's”
Reviews.Author: Evan G
Reviews.Content: My stay was clean and quiet. Hotel is modern with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business purposes”
Reviews.Author: Caetas
Reviews.Content: I stayed a couple times at the Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn for business purposes. The hotel is comfortable and rests in a quiet corner of Vineland Av., despite the proximity with the 101 Highway. Decoration is in colonial style, most likely original from the 70's, with a few interventions here and there. Rooms are very comfortable, large and with good beds and pillows, but the bathrooms need some refurbishment. There are IR lamps on the bathroom ceiling with a timer, so you can warm the room before you get out from the shower, which is an extra comfort I liked (I stayed in Jan '10 and it was freezing in LA!). The hotel has two buildings and I stayed in both. I recommend to stay at the building facing the reception, for there are no rooms under the street level, which are colder and more humid in the winter (these are in the Portola building). There's a good pool, jaccuzzi and sauna for amenities, with the hotel providing extra towels for the guests. They sell bottled beer in the pool as well. Breakfast is served at nearby Tula's Cafe and is reasonable, nothing to complain at all. In the same facility, there's also a bar/lounge, pretty regular and good if you don't want to drive to have a few drinks after work. Through Vineland Av. at left, you walk 4 blocks and find a Rite Aid Pharmacy and a Starbucks Coffee for last-minute items, which is very good in a city you have to do everything by car (that annoys me!). Staff is attentive and helped me whenever I needed.There's a free internet center with two computers and printer. I didn't remember if there was Wi-Fi in the hotel. You have a good parking lot, which is charged apart from the daily rate, as far as I remember it's something around $ 10 a day. For two business trip, It was always a good option for me, for I could rest and stay at the pool after very demanding working days.

Reviews.Title: “Clean BUT surprisingly disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: ChellyG
Reviews.Content: First off I will say overall the place isn't bad at all... the rooms were clean, spacious & plenty of amenitites.... The staff was friendly & shuttle service was awesome! the downfall .... well they have a bar that stays open till midnight or one am something like that, so that tells me that people must utilize it in the fact that they are able to keep it open.... so with that being said expect some noise... I was on the 3rd floor I was told I was in a nice quiet area bot were they wrong or I was just unlucky... 1am a loud group down below.... 2am a loud couple down below both right outside our balcony.3am a loud sports car of some sort.. I called the front desk and guess what NO answer both times..... !!!! When I am paying $200 a night I want a guaranteed good nights sleep & I did not get that..... in the morning I let the front desk know about the noise and all she did was write soemthign down and said she will investigate.... Investigate what? I was totally dissapointed in that matter. I think next time we travel to Universal Studios we'll be staying at the Hilton or Sheraton....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Konigafon
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, beautiful rooms, good restaurant for both snacks and evening meals. Location isn't great, but there is a shuttle bus which goes to Universal Studios, which was great. L.A is vast, so no matter where you stay, you will be far away from something. Good base for daytime exporing, not alot happening at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a few days in LA”
Reviews.Author: DomfromLondon
Reviews.Content: Pretty much as you'd expect from a Holiday Inn - decent quality, reasonable price, efficient, friendly staff. Restaurant pretty good here too, though be warned about the wasabi strength. Great place for a stop in LA having been on a road trip on Highway1 - facility to do laundry was good, though no man machines, but wasn't an issue for us, staff all very helpful, particularly gift shop. Wifi, cannot fault out stay except one of the two lifts was out of action for 24 hours. We had 2 rooms for 3 nights. We overlooked the pool and were glad we weren't on ground or 1st floor as a result. Ample parking.

Reviews.Title: “The best family accommodation on our entire trip of 5 stops”
Reviews.Author: Noodnut
Reviews.Content: Very clean, great facilities including a small playground. Fantastic restaurant which also accommodates kids brilliantly. We happily booked and paid for an extra night due to a late flight out and we're very well looked after.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - bit far from main attractions”
Reviews.Author: JamoccishGirls
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a 45min â€“ 60min drive from the airport. Check in was quick and easy and our room was nice and spacious. The air conditioning is a bit noisy and the shower is over the bath but apart from that everything was really nice. Unfortunately we didnâ€™t have time to use the pool but it looked nice and in the evening they had a fire by the pool that they would light up which looked lovely. Also never used the restaurants here but they also looked really nice. The free shuttle into universal was extremely handy and it would also stop off at the metro if requested however it isnâ€™t too far a walk from the hotel if you miss the shuttle. There are also some shops and different restaurants at the end of the street that are within easy walking distance. For our full trip report refer to the Los Angeles forum.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Univasal”
Reviews.Author: vic_fernandes7
Reviews.Content: Free hotel shuttle has a limited timetable, but is walking distance to Universal Studios. Restaurant had nice food although I ate out most nights at Universals Citywalk. Pool was clean quiet most days, weekends busy but pool not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a Visit”
Reviews.Author: Imation
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Beverley Garland as our first stop upon ariving in LA and the USA. Although the hotel is out of the Hollywood 'maddness' this is actually a good thing. The hotel has some great amenities, reasonable and clean rooms and a good restaurant. We had dinner there and it was very good! The shuttle bus is a great service and the metro stop gets you straight into the main strip in Hollywood. The service at the shop and concierge was very helpful (thanks Barbara!). Overall would certainly reccomend for an easy stay.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but noisy”
Reviews.Author: JoanneBrussels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. The hotel is a cosy place, quite close to Universal Studios and Hollywood, but if you want to go somewhere else (beach, downtown, etc) it's a long haul. There was some sort of party going on during our first night, but no noise from the party could be heard in our room. However, traffic noise was very disturbing at times, but that's the price you pay for being close to connecting roads. We had a room on the 5th floor; good bed, nice bathroom; all we needed. Despite the good comments about the hotel's restaurant, we found it nothing special (maybe we're too spoilt where food is concerned?) Breakfast was okay, but again, nothing special. Restaurant staff was very professional, but disinterested.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Morgan1974
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. The bedroom was very comfortable but because my room was on the first floor I had no view to speak of.The food in the restaurant was really good (the cheesecake was to die for). The shuttle bus was very useful and, on request it would drop off and pick up from Universal City Metro Station. Unfortunately a couple of times I ended up at Universal Studios because the driver forgot to turn off - this meant that I reached the platform just in time to see my train pull out of the platform. Also, if you request a taxi, can I suggest that you go to reception about 10 minutes before the time you requested it for as, through no fault of the hotel, they seem to pull in, wait for a few minutes and then disappear and you end up having to wait until another taxi can get there. The staff in the boutique are extremely helpful with advice on transport, trips or any other questions you might have. I would have no hesitation in staying here again and can't wait to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Suprise”
Reviews.Author: henryhjw01
Reviews.Content: Beautiful oasis in a busy area, convient to Universal studios and Hollywood area, comfortable room , good parking, nice onsite resturant, have a shuttle to Universal but didnt take it so cant comment. but less than 5 minute drive there.

Reviews.Title: “Almost like a resort...”
Reviews.Author: annhMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bevery Garland for 4 days and loved it ! I initially booked this hotel after reading Trip Advisor reviews - and the positive reviews that encouraged me to book this lovely hotel were spot on. There's a regular courtesy bus to Universal Studios ( a few minutes away), and the drop off spot is right at the entrance. We also used this service to transfer onto our 48 hour hop on hop off bus tour as Universal Studios is a stop on the tour (Great tip from a previous Trip Advisor review). The room itself was very clean and comfortable & the hotel facilities were excellent - great pool area & a nice restaurant too. We arrived very early in the morning after a long flight and expected to be denied access to our room until later in the day. However the staff on duty welcomed us , acknowledged the long journey and allowed us into the room ahead of the normal check in time, which was very much appreciated. Loved this hotel & would recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grayse
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay. We took advantage of the Universal Getaway which included a 2 night stay plus 2 day general admission to Universal Studios with complimentary transportation. Beautiful hotel with a relaxed atmosphere and a lot of ambiance complete with pool, jacuzzi and sauna and workout facility. The complimentary breakfast buffet was very disappointing with limited food selections, no juice bar, no coffee at the buffet. Had to wait for wait staff to bring it to you (usually got it by the time you were finishing your meal). For that reason I give them 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “A Resort in Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: Vito T
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in several hotels in the Hollywood/Universal area, but I think this is the only one that is more like a resort than a hotel. There are 3 "hotel" buildings on the grounds; a nice pool/jacuzzi/sauna area, a lounging area with tables, umbrellas and 2 patio covers; a restaurant, bar and poolside bar. The grounds are nicely landscaped. Each room has a sliding door to a small balconey. They have a bus to take you to Universal Studios that runs every 1/2 hour to hour. It's conveniently located where the 101 and 134 meet, so it's a very easy to drive to the Hollywood and Highland area. Tour companies will pick you up at the hotel, also. The only downside is traffic noise from the 101. Be sure to ask for a room not facing the highway. We'll definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for universal studios...”
Reviews.Author: eamonnevangelists
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, nice pool, relaxed vibe, free shuttle to universal (drivers can also book you onto a Hollywood tour), clean rooms, decent restaurant. If you don't have a car then it's expensive using taxis to attractions other than universal. There's an efficient public transport bus service for a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but far away from most things”
Reviews.Author: LibbyLovestoTravel
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel - it had a lovely ambience, with great decor. The rooms were large, clean and up to date. The wi-fi was free. The restaurant was first rate - fab choice of food and great service for a very reasonable price. We ate there often - although also because the hotel was in the middle of nowhere. We booked to stay here based on price and also for proximity to Universal Studios as we had planned to leave our baby with a sitter while we did the VIP tour. I ended up not doing the tour so we need not have stayed there! To get anywhere other than Universal was a real trek. To use the train we had to use the hotel shuttle to Universal City. Public transport was really not an option after we tried it the first day and we spent literally hours waiting for trains and buses. We then hired a car and it was fine. Would we stay here again? Probably not, but not because of the actual hotel which is lovely. If it were closer to Hollywood we would definately stay here every time! By the way do not book a car through the hotel's recommended hire company - the car was a complete bomb and we were charged a LOT of money for what I had hoped would be a current model Audi A4!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: 686lauran
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011 as part of our trip to Las Vegas, LA and San Francisco. Out of the three hotels we stayed in this was the best!! Excellent location with free shuttle bus to the Universal Studios and you can ask the driver to drop you at the Metro station. All of the staff was really friendly and helpful . Rooms really good size and really clean. Nice restaurant attached to the hotel, â€˜Tulaâ€™sâ€™. We seemed to be there when all the staff where on their first day so we had a few hiccups with orders and a $24 bottle of wine seemed to make it on to our bill but once we pointed it out they soon fixed it. Really nice food served!! Would definitely recommend the Beverly Garland Holiday Inn to friends â€“ make sure you ask for a room away from the road!!

Reviews.Title: “The free shuttle bus was great. It felt like having a friend giving you a lift”
Reviews.Author: suebrown869
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights early Sept and would recommend it. We received a very warm welcome from the concierge staff...great attitude. All the staff had a great customer service attitude which is often missing in bigger hotels. Our room was large and the balcony a welcome bonus. The coffee machine made a decent filter coffee and the choice of firm or soft pillows felt like added value. The only downside in the room was noisy airconditioning which we had to turn off to get to sleep. Food in the restaurant was consistently high standard and we enjoyed eating outdoors. My son enjoyed the Dive in Movie evening in the pool...nice idea! The staff in the gift shop were particularly competent on advising the best options for travel to local attractions (we took the open top bus to Santa Monica beach and used the free shuttle to the metro to go to Hollywood Boulevard) The regular shuttle to Universal Studios was great for a hassle free night out at their City Walks where there are live bands, top notch cinemas, lots of restaurants etc. A concierge drove the shuttle bus, so it felt like a friend coming to pick you up after your evening out!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay for the Aussie tourist!”
Reviews.Author: Kangaroo7
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with great service from reception to ground staff & the guys who manage the shuttle bus. After a long 14 hr flight it was a pleasure to reach the Beverly Garland. The rooms were clean and comfortable, service amazing & staff helpful & approachable. A relaxing place to stay. Great pool area & brand new laundry facilities on site. Convenient location - close to universal studios & shuttle bus is brilliant. Will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and hotel for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Dfenz
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for a few nights in June/ July. This is the first time we'd looked to stay in a hotel in Hollywood as we normally are based in Anaheim when visiting Los Angeles. We were very pleased with this hotel from the outset. Very efficient and friendly staff, good hotel facilities, including the 'movie by the pool' nights which were very popular although we didn't get to do these as we were too busy at Universal. The hotel has a free shuttle bus to Universal which is very very convenient and saves on parking at Universal which can be a right pain. The shuttle bus isn't the largest but it will return for guests who are unable to be facilitated immediately. It allows you to have a beer or two at Universal City walk. The room was spacious and clean. Breakfast was efficient. However, I found the buffet a bit bland and not exactly inexpensive. Although kids eat free the menu for this is limited and we found we had to pay for breakfast our kids would eat. The hotel is not far from the freeway although it is very easy to miss the turn-off if coming across from the Highway 5 and the Hollywood Freeway as you have to cut across very quickly once it merges with the 101. The hotel is within an easy drive of Warner Bros studios which I'd highly recommend. The hotel wasn't the cheapest on our trip but represented good value given the comfort and location, The beds were very comfortable and we all slept soundly. Furthermore the carpark is secure and only accessible via a guest keycard.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: M00123
Reviews.Content: Location good, very close to Universal Studios. Hotel offers free shuttle bus service to this attraction. Our hotel room was clean. Laundry facilities available - need quarters though. Front counter staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay and loved it!”
Reviews.Author: debdeg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here several years ago for it's location to sites we were planning to visit and had a great stay. This time was even better! It has been rennovated, with a lovely atmosphere. The room was spacious and well appointed. Beds very comfortable. The bathroom was on the small side, but did allow for adequate storage. The grounds definitely set it apart. Lovely wooded area that is resort like. The pool area is exceptional. Large and comfortable with an outdoor fireplace lending a wonderful atmosphere, poolside bar, hot tub and a nice shower area. Located very conveniently to Universal, CBS and the highways, access was no problem. We only ate breakfast in the restaurant and enjoyed it opting not to have the buffet, though it looked very good. (Too much food for us!) We would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but a bit far away for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: Adrian C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Beverlys Garlands as part of a stopover on teh way to Hawaii. The taxi from the airport for 4 peopel cost $80 which was a little cheaper than the price quoted for the shuttle bus. The hotel is however 25 miles from LAX so not the best place for a stopover albeit two nights. We found teh rooms a little dated but spacious and the on site bar and restuarant to be adequate. The regular shuttle bus to Universal Studios was good but very crowded on return resulting in us getting a taxi on two occasions. We were recommended a british pub 'Fox and Hounds' nearby and went there for a meal but it wasnt great. When next returning to LA we would stay nearer to downtown/airport
