Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel and great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: dranreb69
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the hotel as part of a 14 night fly-drive from San Francisco to San Diego. We found this to be an excellent choice. The rooms were good standard and the food in the restaurant was high quality for reasonable prices. My Italian wife and her sister are not easy to please on the culinary front but they did not have a bad word to say about the food here. We also found the pool area and the internal courtyard to be useful amenities. The low-spot of our stay in Los Angeles was the trip to Universal Studios. This has almost nothing to do with the making of films and is just a theme park with rides for children and lots of food and drink places looking to take your money. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Beverly Garland Hotel Review - Perfect for Families Visiting SoCal!”
Reviews.Author: skecanj
Reviews.Content: We discovered this gem of a hotel quite by accident through Priceline.com and boy, what a find! The room we had (kids' suite + king bed room plus breakfast) was well worth it. The restaurant was nice, and that way we got breakfast out of the way early & didn't have to go anywhere else. It's listed at $240 a night, but we got a deal through Priceline. The only surprise was the extra $14 we had to pay for parking. But hey, it's L.A., so I guess that's appropriate for the area. The Beverly Garland hotel is the perfect solution for families visiting Universal City Studios and other Southern California attractions. Hollywood & Vine, Grauman's Chinese Theatre, Madame Tussaud's Hollywood Wax Museum, and so much more are just a brief drive away. Or take the complimentary shuttle, which will take you pretty much anywhere, even to the Metro subway (I felt safe riding it with our kids, by the way). Kids' Suites are what make the Beverly Garland hotel perfect for families. We stayed in the Deluxe Kids' Suite room (it's huge!), which has a partitioned-off area that gives kids the sense that they have their own room. Its kid-friendly decorations, separate TV, CD player, video games, and bunk beds made our kids feel right at home. The freeway is nearby, but it didn't bother our sleeping at all. In the "adult" part of the room (by itself it's twice as big as a regular motel room at least), there's a king-sized bed, dining table and chairs, another TV, wireless Internet, coffee maker, refrigerator, microwave, comfy sofa, and more. So both us adults and our kids had an area to ourselves to take a break from being together 24/7! Nice. The kids enjoyed the pool and the nice play area. Kids stay free, btw, and they eat free at the restaurant on the premises. In the summer the Beverly Garland hotel has "dive-in" movies and a poolside bar. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel! We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, shuttle was great, bathroom, restaurant and parking were poor”
Reviews.Author: kkotarek
Reviews.Content: If you only want to spend one day at Universal Studios you can't beat the free shuttle and the location, much more than a day and you may begin to question the hotel choice. We arrived on a Tuesday after 8pm and headed right to dinner which was disappointing for the price, the wine selection was limited to four choices total; my son's grilled cheese stated it comes with fruit yet it arrived with French fries and the molten chocolate dessert was more like dry cake with Hersey's syrup. The pool area was enjoyable, the fitness room was nice, parking was limited, bathroom was crowded and the walls very thin. The shower was in need or repair and I almost took pictures to post but decided not to bother.

Reviews.Title: “Great family rooms and dive in movie.”
Reviews.Author: latham_10
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Had family room with separate bunk bed area which kids loved and had it's own tv. Kids loved dive in movie in the pool. Pool never busy when we were there. Super hot hot tub. Tulsa restaurant had fabulous food, reasonably priced and kids ate free. Ate there nearly every meal time. Double doors to balcony so freeway noise not and issue. However air con was like a train in the room! Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: readplaysleep
Reviews.Content: I am from LA - born and raised. I knew nothing about this hotel as we lived on the west side of town. We were coming to town for the weekend (we now live in the northern California) and my parents suggested this hotel. It is the perfect location for LA. It is the perfect stop off of the 5 (20 - 30 minutes past Magic Mountain - so excellent) and we love the hotel. The grounds are lovely - even has a play structure for the kids. It feels so safe and the staff is very nice. We loved the pool and the fireplace made it perfect for a night swim for all of us. We already plan to stay there on the next visit. Watch out, it sells out very quickly! It is a favorite and we have sent many people there already. Cannot wait for the next trip. We have the Kids Suite! We love the Beverly Garland!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: McFadge
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights after returning from 5star hotels in Hawaii and las vegas.We were on our honeymoon and the beverly garland treated us better than either of these hotels. The Beverly Garland was the only hotel to bother recognising that it was our honeymoon with a beautiful gift in our room on arrival. A super, well run hotel at Universal.Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aussiegirl056
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I stayed at the Beverley Garland for four nights from 23rd May 2011 and loved it here. We were very tired after a long flight from Australia and asked the check-in lady if we could have a quiet room so that we could get a good sleep before exploring LA. The room we were given was great - lovely and quiet in a wing away from the main area of the hotel. The room was very clean with a beautiful comfortable bed and a great shower! Two things that are important to travellers! There was also a coffee maker which we found other hotels that we stayed at did not provide. We love a cuppa before we get going in the morning and cannot understand why other hotels don't provide this basic service. Also another bonus at the Beverley Garland was having a guest laundry in the building we were in. It was great being able to do some laundry before heading to San Fransisco. All these things are included in most hotels in Australia but the Beverley Garland was the only place we had these in America - so thanks heaps! We used the free shuttle a few times and this also is a great service. Very convenient. A big thankyou to the ladies in the gift shop for all their help also. They go out of their way to help with any question a tourist has and also have well priced souveniers and little extras that a guest might need. Overall, we found everyone at the BG was very helpful and friendly and a lovely place to stay. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good facilities and location”
Reviews.Author: Philippa M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as the first stop on our californian driving tour and arrived at 10pm. We had a wheelchair accessible room for two nights( requested) the walls were a little thin however the room facilities were good,clean and spacious. The wheelchair accessible bathroom/ wet room was large with good shower access. The reception staff were informative and helpful and the hotel food available was good standard and quite varied. Although our air conditioning unit touch controls broke, the engineer was quick to come and fix it and very apologetic this had happened. The hotel was in an excellent location being 10 mins to Universal studios via the hotels free wheelchair accessible shuttle bus. As we only had one full day in LA this was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “wouldnt stay here again”
Reviews.Author: LandBG
Reviews.Content: We said one night prior to joining a cruise. It was miles from the airport and we had to pay $75 for a taxi to the hotel and asked the hotel to get us a taxi to the cruise port the following day. Having been told it would be c. $80 we were charged $125. The travel agent had recommeneded the hotel for location to Holywood. We got a 20 min bus ride to get to holywood main area to pick up the open top bus trip, thanks to the very helpful lady in the gift shop com tourist info desk who also gave us a map for $3 per person each way. The staff in the rest of the hotel were surly with a could not be bothered attitude. The lift was broken near our room and we had to walk round to the other end of the building to find the other lift to get cases to and from the room. Rest of the time we used the stairs near our room which was like a service/staff route with concrete steps and no decor. It was more like a motel than a hotel, but the room although cramped was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not baby friendly!”
Reviews.Author: SteveStandish
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family which included a ninth month old baby. Attempting to get boiled water to sterilise baby equipment was an absolute nightmare. Helpful front desk staff explained that there were no facilities for boiling water.We have travelled extensively in the US staying in many different hotel chains and this is the first that doesn't provide tea and coffee facilities in the lobby.We were advised to try the onsite restaurant where they tried to charge us for boiled water.This seemed quite bizarre as the lady was positioned in front of a Kids Eat Free sign.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay, great for kids!”
Reviews.Author: BrianMcGinn
Reviews.Content: 2 night layover at the perfectly situated hotel. Purchased Universal tickets from onsite shop with very helpful lady who also gave lots of great advise on rides and shopping in North Hollywood. The check in and out team were great who offered and booked myself and our family a limo to LAX. The pool area was perfect after a long haul flight. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet for our family 2 x adults 3 x kids. Will be recommending to all family and friends in NZ and Europe to stay on layovers. many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: manda1405
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Check in was prompt and staff very friendly and helpful. Having booked a double room we found it to be modest but clean and met our needs perfectly. We were on the 7th floor with our small balcony overlooking the pleasant courtyard and pool area. This hotel has a small gift shop where staff double as concierge and were very helpful when booking our airport shuttle. There is also a coffee shop and a restaurant on site which was very good. Special mention must go to the free shuttle service to Universal Studios and City Walk (around 5 minutes away) which the hotel provides at regular intervals throughout the day. The drivers were very accomodating during busy periods, making extra journeys to ensure all guests were taken to their destination. Hotel location was perfect for our needs since we had planned time at universal studios and any tours we took, picked up from the hotel. There are plenty shops, cafe's and a pharmacy at the end of the street. The staff at BGHI are a credit to the hotel and we would definately return when next visiting LA.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: happytravelerstarke
Reviews.Content: Bert Seneca and his staff bent over backwards to make our stay absolutely superb. Couldn't ask for more. I enjoyed working out in the gym--very well-equipped. Also, the property is easy walking distance to grocery and drug stores and several great restaurants. The ladies who run the gift shop double as concierge and they are fantastic! They gave us very helpful and complete recommendations. Keep up the wonderful work! Hope to see you again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice for Families in LA”
Reviews.Author: photoiq
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at the Holiday Inn and weren't disappointed. Recently refurbished, all rooms with small balconies, modest but immaculate pool (pictured), excellent poolside food, nice planting (you can't believe you are in the middle of the city) and excellent service. I stay in Holiday Inn properties for business every month and this isn't a typical HI hotel - definately a couple of notches above that - although the room interiors feel familiar. Only negatives, both unusual for Holiday Inn: having to hire a refidgerator at $10 per day and $15 per day parking ($12 with your priority club card). Location was excellent for Universal (5 mins) and we went to to the Hollywood Bowl one night which was really close. For the price I really couldn't fault this hotel and will book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great Staff and a great time!!”
Reviews.Author: tanya123-11
Reviews.Content: Anyone going to Hollywood should consider staying at the Beverley Garland. Fantastic place to base yourself with very helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay for many reasons!!”
Reviews.Author: BJL85
Reviews.Content: We visit our son in LA often but have never stayed at this hotel before. We just loved EVERYTHING about this place. The location is great...close to Universal Studios...easy access to the Freeways.... The hotel staff at this hotel are extremely friendly and accommodating. The hotel felt like our home away from home, they allowed family to come visit without paying for parking. The room was very clean, spacious and comfortable. We don't know why we ever stayed anywhere else. This is definitely be our destination hotel whenever in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location For Universal Studios.”
Reviews.Author: Glyn_Derby
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel and received excellent service from all of the staff who made us feel valued guests during our stay. The rooms were large and very comfortable offering us a good nightâ€™s sleep prior to our visit to Universal Studios. The location to Universal is 5 minutes away by car. It is worth mentioning that the hotel runs a free shuttle bus from 08:30 in the morning which runs every 30 minutes. There is also a scheduled timetable for your return. On site at the hotel is a restaurant which serves a buffet breakfast and a selection of meals in the evening. There is also a coffee shop and bar. There is also a poolside bar. Saturday evenings the hotel shows a movie at the poolside where children and adults can have a swim. This is known as the "Dive In" Movie.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Armone1
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying the Beverly Garland holiday Inn Los Angeles is TOP NOTCH in all departments, Service was execellent, when the bus broke down to take people to universal studios, the hotel mangers use their own cars to shuttle the guests, that was wonderful. The inside of the hotel and the outside were clean as a whistle, with cozy louge chairs all about, free newspapers and lovely decor. The pool was clean and inviting, the pool lougers soft and relaxing, and the pool bar ready to serve drinks and tasty lunch fare.For breakfast lunch and dinner their on site restaraunt Tula is the perfect choice for all your dinning needs.Now to the rooms, me and my family stayed in the kids suite which had a space for the kids with bunk beds tv and walls seperating the parents area. room also had fridge micorwave and safe, it was all very nice and clean. The Beverly Garland Holiday Inn with its perfect location to all attractions and wonderful staff to help you get to all of them is the perfect choice for a tremendous Vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A great start to the holiday”
Reviews.Author: Ruddy-Tripper
Reviews.Content: From the warm welcome to the free shuttle bus to Universal Studios, we loved this place. The rooms are clean and spacious and the balcony was a great place to start or finish the day. Even with 4 of us in the same room, it never felt crowded. Free WiFi and an excellent pool and restaurant completed the experience, and it is only 10 minutes to a range of shops. Only downside is the rumble of the I101, but you soon get used to it.

Reviews.Title: “â€œGreat Hotel, Fantastic Staffâ€�”
Reviews.Author: Ana9222298
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with young children, The rooms are comfortable very nice clean and quiet, if the door is shut you don't hear the noise. Fast free WiFi internet in the room, The pool and hot tub are great very relaxing, bartender name Byrom was so friendly. Restaurant had good food and service, our waitress Sonia was very kind and friendly. Good free shuttle bus to Universal Studios. The front desk name Deone was extremely helpful, welcoming, Amazing Staff. I would highly recommend a stay at the Beverly Garland.

Reviews.Title: “Good family choice near Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: s2mc
Reviews.Content: While the Hilton and Sheraton are closer, the Beverly Garland is just a 5-minute shuttle away and has family suites with semi-separate bunk beds for the kids and separate TVs. The rooms are standard sized with good linens and comfortable mattress and pillows. The staff was courteous and helpful. We arrived early but they found us a room for early check in. Housekeeping addressed requests quickly. And, while the shuttle to Universal was supposed to run a limited schedule, the drivers added runs to acommodate crowds. Standard pool and hot tub are surrounded by huge trees and landscaping. Poolside lounge and onsite restaurant are good in a pinch, although service is leisurely at best. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: DutchieGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Beverly Garland for one night in February - it was meant to be 2 but I was going to an event at Staples Center on arrival into LA so needed to stay closer on my first night. The hotel is close to Universal Studios, and is a bit out of the way from the other main tourist areas of LA, but it is a very nice hotel and not overly expensive either. The hotel has a pool (did not use as it was too cold, but it was big and looked good), a gift shop and a restaurant (Tula's Cafe) which was surprisingly cheap. There are not so many places to eat nearby, so unless you have a car or want to eat at Universal StarWalk, you're pretty much left with Tula's. The hotel offers a free shuttle to Universal Studios (it runs approx every hour), and if you ask, they can drop you off at the subway station which is on the way to Universal (and presumably they will pick you up from there too if you let them know which bus you want to take back). The room was a decent size, and even though it was right by a main road, I had no problem with traffic noise in the room. I even had a little balcony that would have been nice in the summer. I couldn't work out how to use the heater in my room, and I asked at reception and they sent someone to help within 10mins. The bathroom was a decent size too with all the usual amenities you'd expect. The bed was comfortable. There was room service available, but I just ate at the cafe (dinner x 2 as I had a late flight out on the day I was leaving and breakfast x1). As I mentioned before, the cafe was surprisingly cheap for a hotel restaurant, and it had a good variety of food. The service there was very good also - but as it wasn't peak season, they weren't so busy. Oh, there is also free wifi at the hotel - bonus. Now, to the reception staff - they were fantastic! I arrived quite early (around 10am) and I was able to check in to my room straight away (again, this was off season). The girls were more than happy to answer all of my "stupid" tourist questions (like how much are you supposed to tip, and how do I work the heater hehe) and they were great when I left my camera in the lobby after my airport transfer turned up 30mins early - they had it sent to my hotel in New York. If you are looking for a decent mid-range hotel, then this is a great place to stay. I'd certainly recommend it to my friends, especially if they were planning to to go Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back soon!”
Reviews.Author: Hollywood0620
Reviews.Content: My son and I travelled from Florida to LA for an acting camp that was being held at the Beverly Garland. I have to say that at first I was reluctant to stay at a holiday inn. Ok that may sound bad to some of you, but we are just not use to staying at Holiday Inns. I have to say that we were pleasantly surprised and our overall experience was wonderful. The staff went out of their way to make our stay special. It was like a home away from home. From the cozy movie night around the pool, to the great food at Tula's, we were pleasantly surprised. For any of you missing southern cooking, the pot roast was my son's favorite. The location was great. There was a rite aid drug store and Ralph's grocery within walking distance and the gift store at the hotel has just about anything that you might have forgotten. ie toothbrush is Complimentary. A special thanks goes out to Vic, Petra, room service guys who asked each morning how my son was doing with his acting, the wonderful woman in the gift store who wouldn't sell Red Bull to the young campers because she knew it wasn't good for them, and to the woman at the front desk who helped by using her paper cutter to downsize my son's head shots to 8 x 10. Welcome to Hollywood!!! I want to say thank you for making our two week experience delightful and unforgettable. We can't wait to come back and see you all soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Universal Studios visit”
Reviews.Author: earthsinger
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious and the bed very comfortable. I'd read reviews recommending asking for a room on the non-freeway side of the hotel, but due to late evening arrival and hotel being fully booked, this was not possible. The noise was not a problem though, could hardly hear it due to double glazing. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the regular shuttle to Universal Studios was excellent, and Tula's Restaurant food and staff were great. Grocery shopping and restaurants are a five minute walk down the road, try the Fox and Hounds pub - friendly people, good food and live music. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonylast47
Reviews.Content: Rooms were cleaned every day. Service was great, staff excellent and friendly. Room was comfortable. Position of toilet next to bath/shower a bit awkward though. Breakfast good, but the buffet breakfast was a bit dried up, especially the bacon which was always too crispy and over cooked. All rooms were double glazed, so noise from the freeway didn't disturb.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: annabelle2904
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived here we knew we were going to have a good time. The staff on the front desk were friendly and helpful and the room we were given was clean, comfortable and spacious. We were able to book tours from the front desk, the conscierge or the gift shop and there was a free hotel shuttle to the metro (which is close by) and to Universal Studios and Universal City Walk. We had free buffet breakfast in Tulas every morning, which was fantastic. Very happy to leave a tip every day. We also had dinner there one night which was also great. The room was quiet, had a great bathroom and large flat screen tv with loads of channels including one dedicated to Beverly Garland. The pool area looked ambient and inviting. The fire was a great added touch. We would not hesitate to stay there again and happy to recommend the place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: mrruiz38
Reviews.Content: There is no microwave in the room nor a mini refrigerator. The wi-fi is bad also.

Reviews.Title: “The best in North Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Maddog1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beverly Garland for 7 nights, Iâ€™ll admit my first impression wasn't great, the rooms seemed a little dated and we couldn't escape the traffic noise from the nearby freeway. However all that changed thanks to the quality of service, I can honestly say the BG is better than any five star I've ever stayed in, Barbara the concierge went above and beyond to provide advice, make bookings and generally make the time spent here very comfortable. The food at Tulaâ€™s cafÃ© was excellent and the staff super friendly and again willing to go out of their way to make things enjoyable. The proximity to Universal makes it perfect if youâ€™re planning a day there and they provide a free shuttle to and from the park. The metro was walking distance from the hotel and there are shops and a few eateries just down the road if needed. All in all I highly recommend the BG if visiting LA and looking for something in the North Hollywood/Universal City area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: kimmer76
Reviews.Content: I would recommend a stay at the Beverly Garland. -rooms: The rooms are comfortable and clean. The room was nicely decorated, however the wallpaper was coming off in the bathroom (which was really not an issue.). The bathroom is smaller than we are used to, only big enough for one person at a time. The patio is tiny, and the freeway is loud. But if the door is shut you don't hear the noise. -pool: We had a great time at the pool. Very relaxing atmosphere. At its deepest it is 5 feet so perfect for my daughter. -service: The front desk was extremely helpful and friendly. Staff on site always offered a smile and hello. The restaurant (Tula's) had good food and service - the best service was given by our waiter Pedro- I have never had a better waiter anywhere! -location: I think this hotel provides the best location if you will be touring Universal or the Walk of Fame. There is a free shuttle to Universal or the Metro (subway.) the bus picks up right across the street. There is a grocery that you can walk to. We enjoyed the quiet at the hotel after our busy days of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Ranssen
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn, and decided to return recently when I was attending a conference in Downtown LA. Traveling in LA it is important to have a car, and as a Priority Club member (the frequent stay program for Holiday Inn), the parking rate was discounted to $11 per night, instead of $14 per night. The breakfast buffet is a reasonable $12.95, and the hotel restaurant is quite pleasant. There is an outdoor lounge area connected to the bar inside the restaurant, so you and your travel companions can enjoy a pleasant drink outside. The room was very clean and quiet. Our room had a small balcony, and it was easy to get to the parking lot from our building. All of the staff are friendly, and were very helpful in the few instances we needed something. I recommend this Holiday Inn for leisure and business travel, if your business needs aren't too extensive.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Airport and Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: zinctop
Reviews.Content: We had three nights here prior to returning to England after our holiday. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly and our room was very clean. Lobby area was welcoming with a large fire being lit in the evenings and the small shop has a lovely selection of momentoes and niknaks for last minute holiday gifts. There is also a nice pool area which stays open until quire late in the evening. Only problem we had was lack of sleep due to the noise from the Freeway all night. However, this would not put us off returning here in the future. The restaurant on site, Tula, was excellent - food and wine were delicious and the atmosphere was lovely. Service was very good and the staff were courteous, friendly and efficient. There is a free shuttle to and from Universal Studios which runs frequently during the day and evening. Overall, we enjoyed our stay (despite the traffic) and would be more than happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Sandpine09
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my honeymoon, as j was Checking in, the lady at the desk congratulated us and iformed us that our room was upgraded. She also arranged us a town car for us to go on a private tour which we enjoyed very much. When we got to the room there were balloons that was tied up to a little gift that had a pivture frame and some chocolates. In the morning we received a personal wake up call from the same person that checked us in the day before and and she also made sure that everything was ok with our stay. A few hours later they called our room and told us that our driver was here, before we left the ladies at the desk gave us some bottled water to take with us on our trip. Everyone at the hotel was wonderful. Everything was perfect with our stay, I had never felt so relaxed and worry free. They confirmed our shuttle ride to the airport the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: susiejo11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beverly Garlands for a full week in May for our honeymoon and both agreed that it was one of the best hotels we had ever stayed at. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. It has a great restraunt and bar which both have very reasonable prices. The free shuttle service to the metro line is also very useful. Overall an excellent place to stay and also central to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location, definately return”
Reviews.Author: claire1507
Reviews.Content: I am a Manager of a travel agency so always have the responsibility of booking the holidays and as this was my father-in-laws 60th birthday, was very anxious that everything would go smoothly. I can honestly say that our stay at the Beverly Garland Holiday Inn could not have been any better. Check-in was brief and the staff were very friendly. Our rooms were great, my partner and I had been upgraded to an Executive room which had a seperate sink area with coffee making facilities and a fridge. Every morning we had maid service and on return one day, had a large hamper full of fruit juice, american sweets, crisps, mints, peanuts, all wrapped up in cellophane with a big bow! We arranged trips through starlines which 'Bev's boutique' at the hotel recommended. We did the full LA grand tour and celebrity homes which was great for our first day. The following day we went to Universal studios and took advantage of the free shuttle bus to the park. The following day we bought the 'hop on hop off' tickets for 48hours which was absolutely brilliant. The buses are a bit old and shabby but to see all the sights, it is worth every penny. We took the free shuttle to universal then from there you can get the starline shuttle to the depot and join the red route around all the main sights or transfer onto the yellow route to go all the way to santa monica which took about two hours in total. The location of this hotel, we all thought was perfect. It isn't in the center of town but we didn't want that. Everything that you want to see is easily accessible if you don't want to drive. Within a few minutes walk there is an area with a few bars and restaurants including a chinese which I looked up on here, it had great reviews and we enjoyed it. Every member of staff that we met were friendly and went out of their way to make sure that our stay was as enjoyable as possible. Our flight wasn't until the evening and we were allowed to keep both of our rooms on until 2pm when joining the holiday inn executive club which was free of charge. We ate in the onsite restaurant 'Tula's' on night and the choice of menu and food was great. We had breakfast every morning in there which wasn't cheap but didn't go anywhere else so have nothing to compare it with. There was an all you can eat buffet for $12.99 or you could order off the menu. All food at breakfast was great. We only drank in the bar once but had to sit outside as the air conditioning was on full blast and it was freezing! When booking holidays for customers, I would definately recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but let down by location”
Reviews.Author: Tiny_Chablis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May for four nights, arrived earlier than the check in time after a long flight and were checked into a room right away without a problem. The reception staff were not overly friendly but neither were they rude in any way. We had a ground floor room in the El Dorado section which was close to the hotel amenities but could get loud being close to the function room. Light sleepers would not like the noise from the air conditioner at ground level right next to the bed. The room was a good size, the king size bed very comfortable. The hotel has the convenience of the shuttle service which is good for visiting the area it services such as Universal Studios but if you want to go anywhere else and don't have a car as we didn't it is a bit far from the action. We got ripped off on one cab ride back to hotel but that was no fault of the hotel. As a result of the location we spent a bit of time in the hotel restaurant and bar. The restaurant meals were large and good value as was the room service. The restaurant staff were probably the most friendly we encountered at the hotel apart from the lady in the gift shop who was excellent in arranging a tour. The bar staff appeared as though they would have rather be somewhere else. One of the better features is the free internet in the business centre. It was a bit cold during our stay so we never got into the pool. Overall this is a comfortable hotel but we would probably stay elsewhere when visiting again only due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money - lovely rooms & good service”
Reviews.Author: Colesee
Reviews.Content: We were on our honeymoon from NZ. The room was nice, and the bed very comfy. All the facilities you need - restaurant, pool, gym, shop - with excellent service! The free shuttle to Universal Studios was excellent. You dont have to be going to the theme park to use it. It will take you to the metro station etc.... We ill definately be back. Planning on booking for a stay in Oct 2014 with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff ... Beautiful Scenery ... Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lindzngreg
Reviews.Content: Loved it!!! It succeeded my expectations. Upon check-in we informed the lady that it was our honeymoon ... right away she upgraded us to a killer room at no extra cost. She went above and beyond to make our stay special. She arranged for a tour guide to come pick us up and take us for a half day tour and the rest of the staff treated us superbly. When we came back from our tour there was a congratulations balloon with some chocolates and a picture frame attached. It was super awesome. The location is great for Universal Studios and they have a free shuttle that takes you there and picks you up. Andy the bell hop is great, super friendly and will give you the shirt off his back. The scenery at the hotel is beautiful and the pool is nice with a fire pit to help keep you warm at night. Tula's restaurant was a great breakfast place ... good food and great service. Overall this hotel is way worth the money for the quality of stay ... I highly recommend it!!! I would stay here again in a heartbeat ... thanks to all the staff :)

Reviews.Title: “Some Santa Fe elegance”
Reviews.Author: witch63
Reviews.Content: This hotel sits on a very ordinary (wide) LA street in an unpromising area near a freeway. However, we really enjoyed it. The hotel is unpretenious and yet has its own elegance in a sort of Santa Fe style, particularly in the reception area. The rooms are nothing special but quite large and comfortable. The beds were great. On the down side, the proximity to the freeway makes use of the (tiny) balcony unattractive, as it is both dirty and noisy. Although the aircon worked fine it was also noisy. The coffee maker in the room was very welcome but a fridge would have been great. Aparently these can be hired but we didn't know that until the last day. A major plus were the very helpful staff in the giftshop who were able to book tours and help with other enquiries. Well done. The hotel is within easy walk of neighbourhood shops, including a good cheap Chinese restaurant, and also of a metro station and bus stops. LA generally is not a place it is easy to walk around but it is possible when not too hot. The hotel provide a shuttle bus to the metro and to Universal Studios which is nearby. The kids also enjoyed the swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “You Have To Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Civilwarrior1
Reviews.Content: Great room, great venue, great restaurant, great staff. What more can I say. If you are in the area and need a place to stay.....you have found it!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: newshoes50
Reviews.Content: I stayed here and found the hotel very comfortable, clean and quiet. I stayed here because I had 3 different friends recommend it. Rates were way better here than other hotels in LA and the room was very clean. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Trying Hard and the attitude is right”
Reviews.Author: 0362Paul
Reviews.Content: 3 nights here in april in a kids suite. Soemwhat dissapointed in the suite as the kids area was simply a partition around 7 feet high. Nonetheless the room was big and clean and suited our needs. Arrival and checkin relatively smooth however receptionist missed that parking was included which was simply careless. Very comfortable bed but fierce aircon sitiuated right next to it. Following morning found a large number of dead and dying flies in the bathroom...very unpleasent but hotel took t seriously and dealt with it quickly. They offered and upgrade which we declined as it was a a kids suite and in any event we did not have time to repack and unpack. Breakfast was at alst a buffett in a Holiday inn and worked well but again the rubbish kids menu that is standard fayre in HI was given to the kids.. Rate included tour of Hollywood but we had to pay extra for the two kids. Wished we had not as the tour was terrible with a driver who simply talked about anything and nothing for over 5 hours. Day 2 breakfast was a disaster. Hotel had closed restaraunt but did not tell us. A conference room was used and at 8.30 it was chaotic. The staff were inundated with guests, there was no food and no plates or anything else for that matter. By 8.50 managers arrived and started clearing tables and finally food arrived. I cannot begin to tell you how bad it was. Had to be on 9.30am bus to Universal so cut breakfast short and waited for bus. It arrived 9.45 and we were left behind with all seats taken by those with sharp elbows and a desire to push. As a result I complained to the duty manager in private but very firmly and left him in no doubt of how I felt. Given I was paying close to $400 a night I expected and required far better than this. It was left that the hotel should make somesort of gesture to make up for flies breakfast and buses. Great day at Universal and we left the next morning following an uneventful breakfast. Noted that the bill had been adjusted by $200 which I thought generous and refelcetd that the hotel is trying and takes things seriously. In all great location for universal, comfortable beds but watch out for aircon. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Value,Pleasant Area, easy access to Universal Studios.”
Reviews.Author: junee_ferris
Reviews.Content: Clean, Quiet, but not able to walk anywhere of interest. No Restautants nearby,other than in house. No shopping Centres.Only 15 mins by Coursty Bus to Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed this place”
Reviews.Author: gram4020
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights last September. I forgot to leave a review, so here it is. As a Brit without the courage to rent a car in LA, I wanted to find somewhere fairly close to Universal Studios which didn't cost the earth. This place seemed to fit the bill. We absolutely loved staying here. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. The pool was nice and the gym, although not very big, was good enough for us. The restaurant at the side of the hotel was excellent. The food was good and the staff lovely. As we never had a car, we were happy to find a supermarket, drug store and a Starbucks within walking distance. If visiting LA again, we would gladly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Illinois60
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st trip to LA & will definitely stay here again on my next trip back to the Burbank area. The staff at the hotel was friendly and very helpful. The rooms were clean, spacious, and very quiet. The courtyard and pool area was relaxing and had many beautiful fountains. The restaurant had a great menu, was reasonably priced and the staff was so friendly. They have a computer room where I was able to print out our boarding passes for our trip home. It is in a great location easy to get to and just blocks from Universal if you plan on going there. The only downfall I would say it has is that you have to pay $14 a day for parking but if you are a Holiday Inn Priority Club Member (which I am) it is $11.....so sign up for Priority Club it's FREE......everywhere in LA you pay for parking. I give it a 5 Star Rating.

Reviews.Title: “Dining Room Staff - A Whirlwind of Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jemcom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property on March 23, 2011 and just wanted to make note of a special team member. We were so impressed by the speed and efficiency of one of the bussing staff â€“ Ruffino â€“ we asked a dining room team member for his name. This gentleman was literally sweating from his efforts. He was an incredible site to behold, and seems genuinely devoted to his position.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but”
Reviews.Author: BOBHAM5114
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 30 miles from the airport so bear that in mind and book the shuttle bus which worked out at Â£40 return altogether for 2 of us. It is next to a busy freeway so i asked for a room away from the freeway and didnt notice the traffic noise at all. The rooms have a small balcony where you can sit outside which is nice, unfortunately for us on the second day of our stay there was this sort of baby beauty show being filmed and you had all these sick parents dressing up these poor little kids with make-up etc, it was disturbing and we could not sit in the patio because of all this comotion. We didnt like los Angeles and wont be back, never felt safe, however i cant fault the hotel on everything else, the rooms were clean and comfortable and Tulas cafe was fantastic, we ate there 5 times in 3 days, the internet is free, we didnt try the bar but there is a very cheap supermarket at the end of the street where you can get wine for $3 a bottle, or there is the fox and hound pub nearby as well. You are only 15 minute walk from the metro train which takes you to centre los angeles in 30 minutes and you can buy a day ticket for $6 and we hopped on and off the train in the couple of days we were there to explore.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: heather0896
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, it is in a good hollywood location, 5-10min bus ride to hollywood blvd and the bus stop is directly in front of the hotel.Tthe rooms are nice and a comfortable size, no complaints really. I was very impressed with the staff in the gift shop, they booked all our trips, gave directions and answered all our silly questions with a smile and endless patience. The hotel also provides a free shuttle to and from universal studios which was greatly appreciated. If you decide to eat at Tula's, the staff are excellent and the Yankee Pot Roast is AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoannaMM
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Christmas and found the hotel very comfortable, clean and quiet. The hotel restaurant is also very good. Would definitely recommend. Good shuttle bus to Universal Studios. You will definitely need to hire a car but I had a very bad experience with the car rental company Basic that the hotel recommends. I raised a complaint when I got back to the UK and it has only been today that it has been resolved as they continually ignored my (polite) e-mails and strung me along for 3 months which was very stressful - I also left messages on their answerphone which were never returned. I had to get the Manager of the hotel involved and it was only by doing that they took any action. However, they have not responded to my last e-mail which was sent on 6th March and I am still not happy with their settlement. I was given a car out for hire in an unsafe state and it is a sham that the hotel use such a bunch of amateurs as their car rental company. They also have a very poor review on a consumer website that my American friend told me about. So beware! I'm very sad that I have to be negative about them but I would not like anyone to have had the experience I did. Thank you anyway to Mr Seneca for contacting them as they never would have gotten back to me otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: ShannonMadison_WI
Reviews.Content: We spent just a one night stay at the Beverly Garland but it was a very nice time spent there. Excellent location to see all the sights in Hollywood, Beverly Hills and Universal Studios. When we arrived we were told by our check in clerk that children 12 and under ate for free in the restaurant off the childrens menu. We enjoyed our breakfast the next morning there. The hotel was quiet, clean and it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “close to universal studios”
Reviews.Author: sf6984
Reviews.Content: The main thing that left me disappointed with my stay here was the unfriendly staff at the front desk. Most of them barely even looked at us when we would enter the lobby, and it always seemed like we were inconveniencing them by asking a question. On the positives, the girl at the gift shop was extremely helpful. The free shuttle bus to the metro and universal studios was convenient and ran frequently, however needs to be bigger in size for the return trips at the end of the day as it always seemed overloaded with people standing or being told to wait for the next bus (the drivers were friendly). Although this hotel is situated further out, the metro was an easy ride and with the free shuttle to/from the station this was an ideal mode of transport for us without a car. We also enjoyed use of the heated pool and spa in a lovely well-maintained area. We ate breakfast at Tula's cafe which is convenient and reasonable priced. There is decent internet access for those without their own, with 2 computers which we found readily available. The room was quiet, beds were big and comfy and bathroom clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good sleep”
Reviews.Author: mlperkins
Reviews.Content: BOoked as part of a route 66 self drive with my two kids aged 3 and 11 Arrived quite late at night having driven from Vegas. On main road near interstate, Easy check in. Pay for aprking which was extremely busy and therefore miles from my room Small room but clean and functional. Restauarant has strict hours for breakfast (not included) Outdoor pool was clean

Reviews.Title: “I really regret staying at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoCheerMom
Reviews.Content: We checked in at night. We were greeted with what seemed like disdain from a man named Jeff at the front desk. How this guy has a job in the hospitality business is a mystery. Our fridge was not in the room so we had to call and it was late but we had to wait for them to bring it up. The next morning the toilet wasnt working so they had to send someone up to the room to fix it while we still had our teenagers sleeping in the room. The same thing happened the next day. We are on a first name basis with the maintenance guys. The remote control to the TV did not work so someone came to replace that too. My bill for 2 nights was almost $400. That included the room for 2 nights the parking there is $14 a night and there was a $10 per night charge for the fridge. The manager did take off one night of parking and one night of my fridge charge, but that didnt really do much for me. I don't recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for Universal Studios & Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: Crouchinho
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the end of our honeymoon and got the Universal Package - including breakfast, parking & 2 tickets for Universal Studios. The breakfast buffet was excellent, and the included extras make this a very good package. The hotel itself was very nice, our room was a king w/balcony and had the feel of a loft apartment. Beds were clean and very comfortable, and the bathroom while a little dated was perfectly clean and adequate. Lots of space in the room and plenty of storage as well as a lounge area. The parking was safe and close to the building. The only complaint I would have is that the windows to the balcony are thin so you can hear the traffic on the freeway in the distance, it didn't bother us but if you're a light sleeper it may do! Overall a very impressive experience and perfect for getting into Hollywood (10 min walk to Universal City Metro) and the free shuttle to Universal Studios is ideal!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: JYUnipart
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn. The staff has always been courteous, pleasant and very attentive. The rooms are clean, comfortable and beautifully decorated. On this trip I ate at the on-site restaurant and was very pleased with the quality of the food. I was doubly impressed when room service delivered a hot meal! The on-site bar has a great lounge atmosphere that plays music videos on several flat screen TV's. I truly enjoyed the pool area, especially in the evening when I could sit close to the outdoor fireplace. Overall, it was great experience staying here and I'm looking forward to my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “OK...”
Reviews.Author: myfiles2000
Reviews.Content: I had issues with the service, i decided to change from my usual hotel chain to Holiday inn at the recommendation of a friend just for a change...when we arrived there was no one outside to tell us if they had valet or if we should unload upfront or to get a luggage cart, we could clearly see their was a post to have someone outside but no one came, check in was basic and quick but had to call 3 times once in the room with questions that they should have told us during checking in...asked for extra towels and they never came...the room was nice, but NOT impressed at all with the service, was lacking in the basic sense, not expecting luxury service just the norm...liked the shuttle service

Reviews.Title: “Marketer”
Reviews.Author: sousa22
Reviews.Content: I recently made a mistake online and booked myself for 1 more day than I needed. Well I happen to find out, I booked this with the advanced purchase, which means...no modifications! So I called the front desk and spoke to the manager and she was very understanding and adjusted the rate for me. I appreciate this service, as I am also in the hospitality industry - and her customer service will bring me back - time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Feels Like Home!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Princess26
Reviews.Content: I loveeeee the Beverly Garland Inn!! I first stayed here back in 2009, so when it was time to come back LA in 2011, there was no hesitation of where I would stay! The staff is always so friendly and helpful. They welcome you to LA and give you helpful tips of what to see if this is your first time visiting the big city. The hotel had a recent renovation so the rooms have flat screen TVs new linens, and FREE wifi which is cool. The pool area was also redone and now has a bar outside and a heated jacuzzi, which I love. Just be prepared to pay $14 per day for parking if you have a car. Which really isn't that bad. Okay, let's discuss Tula's, their restaurant on the premises, it is AMAZING! Make sure you try the California Dreamin with a side of ranch sauce! OMG! Amazing! I literally have one at least 2-3 time while i'm there. Just thinking about it I have to wipe the drool. lol (I've included a picture for you to see) Convenient location, right off the 101 Freeway, which can get you anywhere in LA. There's a nice mini shopping plaza around the corner on Ventura that has a Ralph's Grocery Store, Nail Salon, Ice Cream, Rite Aid, etc. So if you forgot anything, i'm sure you can find it there. The hotel is also 5 minute drive from Universal City Walk, which is a nice place to visit at night if you want to get away. There are a ton of restaurants and bars, a movie theater, and shopping over at the Walk. I highly recommend this hotel for the location, staff, and price. It literally feels like home and I never want to go home -__- Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I Could Have Stayed Longer”
Reviews.Author: sammyms
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to have been going on a cruise and had to change our plans and this meant booking an extra night in Los Angeles. As we were already booked to stay the last night out at LAX we decided we wanted something a bit more central and as we planned to go to Universal Studios the next day this was perfect. I really liked this hotel and if and when I return to Los Angeles I would stay here. The rooms were quite cosy, but the decor was nice and the facilities good. The pool area looked really nice. The hotel operates a free shuttle to Universal Studio's so we took advantage of that to go visit Citywalk that evening for dinner. Universal is only about 5mins drive from the hotel. We ate in the restaurant for breakfast and had the buffet which was very good. The only downside was the rooms are not very sound proofed and with a large freeway behind the hotel it was pretty noisy. The hotel charges about US14 a day for parking, but it was secure and the charge is to be expected in a city hotel. If we had spent longer in Los Angeles this hotel would have been a good base to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Supreme customer service, by all staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelingnurse055
Reviews.Content: Attended a 2 day conference and we were impressed with the courteous and caring staff at the hotel. They do customer service right! The food prepared for our meals was also delicious, many healthy choices available and beautifully presented. All in all, a wonderful experience, I highly recommend this hotel. Also a really well stocked & different gift shop!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE - BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: bedbug4222
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 419. The first night there I was attacked by bed bugs. Unlike most people however I have an allergic reaction to bed bug bites thankfully not to the point of anaphylactic shock but severe enough to need prescription antibiotics and rash/bite cream. Since I was on vacation I needed to go to the ER (Providence Saint Joseph Medical Center) to get treatment and basically lost a day of my vacation time and spent the rest of my vacation at another hotel (which I had to pay more for) in pain. The staff was rude and was more interested in covering their liability. They promptly removed the bed bug we caught in a glass to show them and then hurriedly refunded our one night stay and washed their hands of us. What a horrible experience. I pray I did not bring any bed bugs back home. So far so good. Thank god.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, location not brilliant but good transport links”
Reviews.Author: chrisc1502
Reviews.Content: on arrival the recpetionist was ok with us until i produced my holiday inn membership card and then he got us drinks, re-welcomed us to the hotel and gave us a free upgrade! room was comfortable, bed was comfiest bed iv stayed in at a hotel for years! only problem is the rooms have a green light on the balcony which does not go off at night and there is no blackout blind so its on all night, pool and hot tub r great. we walked to the metro each day because the shuttle to universal city is hourly and doesnt start until 9.30 am and finishes quite early at night so we just walked it, only took 10mins and u can get any where in LA from here. overall good hotel, very nice and no road noise. also free wifi in rooms!!!!!! brilliant

Reviews.Title: “A nicely renovated older hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: brezi
Reviews.Content: This is an older property that has been extensively remodeled. The staff at the front desk was very friendly. The rooms are nice and the bed was very comfortable. There is a little highway noise (and some helicopters going over the hotel the night I stayed) but it wasn't bad enough to keep me awake for long. The room was very clean and the toiletries were from Bath & Body Works. It's just a couple highway exits from Hollywood and a lot of tourist attractions. The pool looked very nice. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for visiting Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: ALLIGATOR9
Reviews.Content: Got upgraded to a suite being a Priority Club Member and got a bag full of cookies, water bottles etc. The welcome to Hollywood was nice. The room was huge & the restaurant in the hotel is very nice. Free Shuttles to Universal studios is what makes this hotel even more attractive. Though was here for only 1 night I am sure it worked well for visiting Universal Studios. Hollywood was next & closeby.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, well serviced”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneMegan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights early January. Great spot, the hotel has been well maintained. Our room had two Queen Beds, flats screen. We stayed in Portolia block, level 6, so not too noisy - I can see others complaining about this, but I asked on arrival for a room away from the freeway. Staff always pleasant and helpful at the front desk. Any staff member you meet outside always very polite. We dined at Tula's Restaurant at the hotel for breakfast and dinner. Miko was out waiter on most of these meals â€“ an excellent and dedicated staff member who has been working at the hotel for over 4 years. He's knowledgeable about the area and a tourist spots was excellent, his table service was impeccable. A top guy to meet if you visit the restaurant! We always looked out to when we arrived at each meal to snag him as our waiter :) Rooms were always serviced very quickly and efficiently every day. The grounds of the hotel are well appointed, clean. This would be a perfect spot to bring smaller children â€“ there is a heated pool and spa also.

Reviews.Title: “I like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ama06
Reviews.Content: I was in LA in October 2010 with my housband and our daughter (4 years), we loved this hotel , for me the most important thing is the room cleaning and in this hotel is very good! the room was clean, spacious and well furnished. The only thing that we don't like it was there's not 'breakfast. The Hotel is near the universal studios and we liked the hotel position we loved the free internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good start”
Reviews.Author: Emiwillseetheworld11
Reviews.Content: Booked & prepaid in Australia. Travelled with Family and sister's family from San Francisco. Rang on the evening of check in to find out that our reservation was cancelled. I asked why it was cancelled when it was all paid for? (The Adults had to make a side trip from Disneyland to Hollywood while we left the teen agers continue with their Disney adventure - so inconvenient -- on such limited time.) The front desk staff had to reinstate my booking, but my sister has had to be booked on the spot... This is very poor service especially when the staff could only bag my agency for explanation!!! So unprofessional. Never had this experience before! Hopefully never again. (Note: My family stayed in 5 hotels in this trip from Australia to Canada and California - fortunately, only one mishap!) The room was good, we were on the 4th floor - a bit noisy but when you're tired- you sleep thru it, the pool, spa and sauna were great - the kids enjoyed them every night in the 3 nights we were there, shame there was no fridge in the room, free wi-fi was great, $14.99 for parking was pricey, beautiful holiday decor, Bed was comfy, great that we could have the adjoining rooms with my sister. Great location . But the phone call to Australia for less than a minute was really pricey about $25 US? Oh the check out staff was great, that was Angela and there was another staff that was great, can't remember her name, but can never forget the names of those two at check in .. the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - shame about one rude member of staff!”
Reviews.Author: CHOCCYScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and the room was nice and clean but nothing fancy. The hotel staff were friendly but we found one of the restaurant staff to be so rude it would actually put me off ever staying there again. This member of staff saw that we were waiting on a table and basically ignored us for a good ten minutes until I asked him if the restaurant was now closed since no-one had the manners to see us to a table! Unfortunately the same man was to be our waiter and when we settled our bill he gave us change of $20 instead of $50 which didn't go down well with us. If you stay at this hotel have a nice stay by avoiding the restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Once again, my home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadtoomuch
Reviews.Content: I visit LA about three times a year and, once again I was at BGHI in December. I've ALWAYS had terrific service from the staff; it's one of the reasons I continue to stay there. Over the years, the ownership has upgraded the grounds, pool area, bar and lobbies. I've heard they're upgrading the restaurant -- a LONG LOOOONNNGGG overdue chore (as my previous reviews have noted) -- and I hope it includes an upgrade to the menu as well. I'm surprised by the recent complaints about the staff. Yea, the front desk staff aren't always at attentive as they could be, but everyone else at the hotel has ALWAYS been extremely service-oriented. The wait staff in the restaurant are the best, especially the breakfast team. I've been tempted to try other hotels in the valley -- and I've done it several times -- but the others cannot compare. Yes, the rooms are dated, but what can do with the old cinder block walls? My experience? If you smile at the staff and treat them with respect, you'll be rewarded in spades. I agree that the wireless is VERY slow. I hope the hotel works on this!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: frenchwood
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hotel was decorated beautifully for the holidays and was very welcoming. We found the front desk staff to be friendly and helpful. We stayed in one the suites on the 7th floor and the room was clean, well decorated, and lots of drawer space to settle in. We loved the two bathrooms! The view from the two balconies was stunning! The bed was very comfortable and the linens soft. I also loved the free wifi! We ordered room service for breakfast both days. The service was fast and the food was delicious. We also loved the bar, charming atmosphere and good prices. I love the fact the hotel is surrounded with trees, you forget you are in the middle of West Hollywood. I think this is a great hotel. . .a hidden gem!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. I will come back!”
Reviews.Author: GoldenKnight1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a vacation with my fiance. The front desk staff and housekeeping was great. No complaints there. The hotel was clean and well kept. Being that the hotel was mainly an outdoor location, it was a pain trying to get to our room in the rain. That's not the hotels fault though because usually LA is sunny. Beds were comfy and the room decor was nice. The restaurant was our favorite part. The food was above average for a hotel restaurant. We ate their twice everyday throughout our stay and we were very satisfied. The only complaint that I have is that the bellman was very pushy for us to go on a tour. I'm sure he gets some kind of kickback on it. We ended up taking the tour and it was pretty good. We got heckled enough walking on hollywood blvd. from these tour salesman, so it was more than we needed being at our own hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Some Good Value, Some not so good”
Reviews.Author: Goteed1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of times recently for quick weekend trips, chose this hotel specifically because the location was absolutely perfect for what I was doing in LA those weekends. The good: Holiday Inn has recently completed it's makeover for the whole chain and did a surprisingly good job. Room was good with the big flat screen, free wifi, LOTS of plugs to charge stuff in, neutral colors, nice bedding etc. Bathrooms are still circa 1970's but they were clean. Public spaces are very attractive with lounges and a firepit. The fitness center is better than average for a hotel as well. The free shuttle to Universal is a good deal, but I didn't really need it. The not so good: The freeway noise. It's really loud. At times it can drown out the TV in the room. Every room has a little balcony, but there is no way to enjoy it with the loud noise. Make sure you ask for a room that does not face the freeway. Also, $14 for parking? Really? In the middle of suburban North Hollywood? That's just greedy for this area. The menu in the restaurants is fine, ate there a couple of times and service was hit or miss. Even though the place is always empty, sometimes the waiter just dissapeared. The food is priced very reasonably and not too bad. Front desk service is at best courteous, nothing to write home about. The both times I stayed here because I got a good rate and could not imagine paying more than $100 to stay here. Although they have a lot to offer, for a higher price point you can get a quieter room with better service else where in the area. Also, almost forgot, if you don't know who Beverly Garland is, the have a a channel devoted to her so you can catch up.

Reviews.Title: “Better stay away.”
Reviews.Author: 00neveragain00
Reviews.Content: For the price they charge $180 per night I would stay somewhere else. Horrible service from front desk to management. Every single day I would ask the cleaning crew for extra 2 towels every single day they would not do it. They charge $14 a day per car for parking and the keys they give just stop working every couple of days. They people at the front desk are just not service oriented. It feels like they have been forced to be there. They double booked one of our two rooms. They charged room service to our room when we ordered takeout. Just one thing over another and never any show of apology, just "OH OK". I had better service at motels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Arrogant staff”
Reviews.Author: JackieAus
Reviews.Content: Staff like that can ruin the reputation of any business. I don't want to spend time detailing the long list of rude comments and lack of service we received in this establishment, but I can assure you it wasn't pleasant. For the first time in my life I saw a hotel with the label of " Holiday Inn" abusing customers. We bought the accommodation via that website Priceline.com, and that gave the receptionists the right to think we're not worth being treated with courtesy and good manners. When my husband approached the reception to check in, he literally heard " WHAT DO YOU WANT?" , hotel was empty but we were given a horrible room, first floor facing the noisy freeway, so uncalled for! We paid for full breakfast in advance, the receptionist never gave us the BF vouchers, he simply assumed we weren't entitled to it and never bothered to even ask, confirm or let alone apologise after we were refused to eat and had to chase whoever could finally confirm we had pre-paid for breakfast.... this is all making our Universal Studios fun day start very late. Restaurant /Breakfast staff also stink like tobacco, it all added up to an expensive stay that was not worthy at all. I'd be happy to pay the 16 dollars a day for the car park if it was a clean, safe place. It wasn't. I left my phone number and email at the check out but never heard from anyone. I can easily remember the names of the worst customer service people in Hollywood too. There is more, for instance.. when I asked one of the staff members what would be the best view room, she answered " It depends if your children want to watch car accidents on the freeway or if they prefer to look at the top of trees" In shock I replied, the tree tops sound good.... in an attempt to see if she'd give me a better room. Bedroom had a smell of mould, internet was *very* SLOW.... and the list goes on.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this full-service hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingbarb2-2
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel. As a Gold Priority Club member, I was upgraded on arrival to what is called a suite, but turned out to be one very large, well-appointed room. One end of the room contained the bed and the other a sofa and two comfortable chairs. There was an open alcove that contained a desk. The bathroom was spacious and very clean. My only complaint with the room was the lack of good lighting on and around the desk. All of the employees I encountered were friendly and helpful. The lobby is comfortable and inviting and there is a gift shop. The restaurant is very attractive and offers a decent selection of items at reasonable prices. It also offers espresso drinks. These days, it is so refreshing and convenient to actually have a full-service restaurant on the premises! Although I did not need the services, the hotel offers shuttle services to area attractions and provides assistance with airport transportation and various tours and also has meeting facilities. I did not use the pool but it looks very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: McKiefer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Beverly Garland Holiday Inn, North Hollywood in October 2010. This is an excellent hotel, rooms are very clean and spacious. Beds were also very comfortable. Both front desk staff, shop staff and Concierge were very helpful. The pool area is very nice. The hotel restaurant has good value meals throughout the day. Hotel service provides a free shuttle service to Universal Studios and Citywalk which runs throughout the day. You can also get the bus just outside the front entrance to Hollywood Boulevard for $1.50 per person. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: gretchel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to meet up with a friend who had already booked to stay here. I had a few problems initially as I was given a key to a room which didn't work so I returned to reception and ta member of staff re-programmed thekey; this time it worked but the room hadn't been cleaned. I was getting a bit fed up by this point as I'd had an early start to my day, so called down and the front desk sent someone up with a key to another room. They also called to apologize and gave me a voucher for breakfast. I guess you can tell how good a hotel is by the way they deal with problems, and I couldn't fault the staff here. The room was comfortable and well appointed; there was quite a lot of road noise but I had read that in reviews prior to my visit so went prepared with ear plugs which did the trick.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently welcoming and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: slox4
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Beverly Garland whenever I visit Southern California (which is frequently). I always find the staff to be friendly (some remember me from previous stays) and the rooms to be clean and well attended to. The restaurant and bar are convenient and are also very good. The pool area is very nice with the new bar, fireplace, jacuzzi, sauna and gym close by. I only wish it were open later (they close up at 10:00 pm, I believe). There is a bit of freeway noise if your room faces north.. but with the balcony door closed the rooms are very well soundproofed, and the convenience of the freeway and the hotel's proximity to the SoCal attractions make the noise less of a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location!”
Reviews.Author: popkid
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again if the location was better, the only thing close by in Universal Studios, apart from that it's a bit of a mission to get anywhere else, you need to et ok the freeway to get to walk of fame, Beverly hills etc.... The rooms are clean and tidy and the staff were very polite and helpful, our phone wasn't working at first in the room but it got fixed once we rang reception. Parking was meant to be $14 per night but when we checked out this was waived, no idea why, we didn't question it (who would) but thought it was nice of them :) the bathrooms are very small, we had 4 people in 1 room so was a bit cramped but overall it was a nice hotel with a very nice restaurant ( we were given a free desert) only downside is the location

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: walshy1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days at beginning of october. I thought overall the hotel was really good. The hotel was very clean and had lots of facilities including a restaurant and bar next door which did great breakfasts, swimming pool, fitness centre and business centre and it runs a free shuttle service every hour to universal studios and the metro. Staff were very friendly. Rooms were clean and modern. Air conditioning is very effective but noisy so couldn't use during the night and also the hotel is situated right next to a freeway and even with the doors shut I could hear it all the time so didn't sleep very well. Other than that the location is very good. Very close to universal studios - 5min drive. Metro is only 10-15min walk away which will take you to all the places you want to see and I felt very safe using it. Supermarket 5mins walk away and several restaurants and eating places close by.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Ending”
Reviews.Author: Scoop-Smith
Reviews.Content: We took the kids on their first trip to Disneyland and Universal Studios. To save money we chose a standard room for the Disney part of the vacation. But I opted for a Kid's Suite for our stay at the Beverly Garland and I am so glad that I did. Our room was spacious and well appointed. The kid's bunk worked out great. They were able to watch TV from the bunks while we enjoyed a show in our area. Since this was the last night of our vacation I figured we would sleep better with the kids in bunks and we did. I slept like baby. They had some kind of memory topper on the mattress and it was sooo comfy. I passed out in record time and slept through the night. This was the only good night sleep that I got that week and it made the drive home the next day that much easier. Also, checkout was at noon so we were able to relax and take our time to get on the road. If I am ever in the Hollywood area, I will definitely stay at the Beverly Garland Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cobaw
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here for 2 nights. Our room was as described. Early check in was a breeze. The staff were all very helpful and we had great service in the restaurant. The pool was nice and clean and a nice place to spend some time. The hotel was in a good location - close enough to walk to the metro/sub-way - although the free shuttle was appreciated there and to Universal Studios. Highly recommended. My only complaint was a pushy man who operates the shuttle service trying to sell me tours - he wouldn't take no for an answer. I had to be quite abrupt and rude to him to get him off my back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service Driven Facility”
Reviews.Author: eventsiam
Reviews.Content: The Beverly Garland and its staff are amazing! This was my 2nd year here and they remembered me, by name, from last year! (and not just the front desk, but most of the staff) The Staff here is top-notch quality and all about making sure I was taken care of and had an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: hoochy1602
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. It is in such a fantastic location, right next to the freeway (didnt have a problem with noise), 10 min drive from Universal Studios. Staff are so friendly. The rooms are really trendy, three wallpapered walls and a rough stone wall. Beds are comfy and large. This hotel was a good start to our trip. We enjoyed this hotelthat much, we are returning to it next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: murphstar
Reviews.Content: Beverly Garland hotel is an excellent place to stay in Hollywood, loved it the staff are very friendly and helpful, also loved the hotel pool and jet pools (also there is an outdoor bar at the bar to keep your thirst away) This hotel is also very close to Universal Studios and offers a shuttle bus service to it, if you don't fancy going to Universal you can get the subway to Hollywood and Highland and go to the walk of fame and Kodak centre!! Also across from the walk of fame is a Disney Soda Fountain shop, def recommend going in there for an ice-cream (you can make your own Sunday excellent to do) To sum up the Beverly Garland in three words i'd say I LOVED IT!! Wish i was going back to LA for my next holiday!!! I have picturs but they are the same as the most recent ones put up, so not going to add them.

Reviews.Title: “Look passed the exterior”
Reviews.Author: AMGWales
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and our stay was very pleasant. The hotel looks a bit shabby from the outside but the rooms were modern,clean and comfortable and the pool was very nice.Parking was a bit expensive but we were in a city. Staff very helpful and the restaurant was very good for an evening meal and for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Was Ok”
Reviews.Author: Skeeta78
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel because it was close to Universal Studios & they offered a free shuttle. Check in took awhile because they had no record of our reservation even though we had paperwork & a confirmation number the staff member was confused & asked for assistance from the manager & his reply was " Oh just give them a room & i'll deal with it later" that might sound like a normal type of a response but it was said with such annoyance & attitude that it put us off staying there but since we were along way from home & had been planning this holiday for a long time & only had 4 days left of our holiday we just tried to ignore it. While checking in we asked if it was possible to have a later checkout which the guy said was no problem, but then was told 2 days later sorry no can do, so we ended up at the airport WAY ahead of time since we were taking a night flight home. The best part of our stay there was a local supermarket down the road called Ralph's which had EVERYTHING that you could ever want, you could even make up your own salad & go to the deli to get some cooked chicken pieces, chips & yummy pasta which was way cheaper than eating in the hotel restaurant. The actual room itself was quiet nice & roomy, though the bed was a little soft for me there wasnt much i could fault about it.
