Would only recommend if Universal Studios is something you want to be close to without a huge price tag.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Original”
Reviews.Author: Odysseus68
Reviews.Content: After being in so many cookie-cutter designed properties, this Holiday Inn really stood out. An older property but perfectly maintained. There were a lot of personal touches in the gardens, pool, and rooms. In the middle of LA, it was a true treat to have many beautifully landscaped areas (with Wi-Fi) to do my work outside the room. Being on a business trip, I was initially concerned that this would be another loud family hotel, but because of the many walkways and patios - family and business co-existed very well. Staff was plentiful, knowledgeable, and friendly. Kudos to you Beverly Garland!

Reviews.Title: “unprofessional staff, dirty sheets and BED BUGS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BINA0815
Reviews.Content: Took ages to check in due to slow reception staff. She barely looked me in the eyes. Bed sheets where dirty (make up stains). Aircon was so noisy that we had to turn it off during night time. Next morning I was covered with bed bug bites, even in my face.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: welshlad1980
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in for a week in June 2010,the location was great even though it is situated by a busy highway not once did we have any problems with noise.Check in was very quick with friendly staff,Parking was a bit expensive but at the end of our stay got offered to join the Holiday Inn club free of charge which included discount parking.The hotel room itself had everything we needed and was very comfortable,the balcony is small but not a problem,The pool area was really nice and has an outdoor fire place.There was a restaurant and it was named after Beverly Garland's grandaughter but we never used it in this trip.Overall we found the hotel to be really relaxing and modern and will be returning in 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel great location would visit again”
Reviews.Author: Brimilne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for before returning to the UK. it was excellent. staff were great restaurant was fantastic. every thing else was top notch. Shop was reasonable. Pool and gym were both great. We got our passed for universal through the hotel and they also throw in a shuttle bus to the park for nowt. The hotel also arranged Hollywood tours and this was included in the price. Hotel was also cheapest in the area for similar level of service. Breakfast was also included which was good if a little basic. We did however have to pay to park this was annoying but due to the closeness of universal I can see why. All in all probably the best hotel we stayed in on our trip

Reviews.Title: “Extremely convenient hotel; great for kids”
Reviews.Author: lynnandmarc
Reviews.Content: Our family of four - including twin nine-year-olds - stayed in one of the Kid Suites at the end of August. The hotel is very close to Universal and, since it's literally right off the freeway, is convenient to almost everything. The room met our needs. It is a converted double room, with a "fort" in place of one of the queen beds. The kids thought that having their own little "room" was cool. In it were bunk beds, a TV, and a bookcase containing a video game system and some shelves with baskets for clothing. Parents, keep in mind that what I've been calling a fort does not have its own door, and the kid on the top bunk can actually look over the top of the fort (if they try) to see your bed, but it did provide a nice divider between the kids and the queen bed. The Kid Suite does come with a refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. We found the room clean enough. What we liked about the hotel beside the Kid Suite were the free shuttle to Universal Studios, the pool (particularly the "Dive In" movies shown poolside Thurs-Sat nights), and the restaurant (free meals for kids). The hotel has a fitness center but no spa; however you can arrange to have an in-room massage by Tamera. A few things mentioned in previous reviews were true: the sleeper closest to the AC will be freezing, there was no fan in the bathroom, and you really can't go out on the terrace without hearing the freeway, but these issues were manageable. If you kept the terrace door closed you really couldn't hear the noise. My only other comment was that there were not enough shuttles coming back from Universal in the evening. The 8:15 PM shuttle filled up and the driver had to make TWO more trips to pick everyone up. I would recommend either a bigger shuttle or additional evening pickups. Other than that, we found the Beverly Garland a good place for families to stay while in North Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “No mini fridge”
Reviews.Author: princesspea01
Reviews.Content: There is no mini fridge in the room which we missed. Not for the overpriced food and drink that hotels usually put in them but for when we brought small qualities of our own stuff. For example you couldn't even have milk on hand for breakfast cereal or your own orange juice or store stuff left over in a take home pack from dinner. The rest was ok but because of this lack of mini fridge I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “There must be better places to stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: Economy_Class_Clive
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok, but our stay there was spoilt by 2 petty things. It is close to Universal studios and the hotel provides a free shuttle bus there via the local metro station which is good. The pool is a reasonable size and the pool area is nice with a bar that is open in the evenings. Our room was ok. There is a car parking charge - about $14 a day I think from memory. The hotel is right next to freeway 101 which makes access really easy, but does mean there is constant traffic noise 24x7. Although our room double glazing was good and kept most of the noise out, it does mean you canâ€™t really sit on the room balcony as it is too noisy The petty things that really spoilt our stay here are:- 1) There is no fridge in the room. You can hire one on a first come first served basis for $10 a day. This seems really petty. I think every other hotel room I have stayed in in the US has had a fridge and many of those hotels were of a lesser category (and cost) than this one. 2) We booked our room for 4 people through hotels.com. The booking said "Full breakfast". But the hotel would not honour this booking condition and would only give complimentary breakfast to 2 people in each room which I thought was quite extraordinary. I have never stayed anywhere that offered free breakfast to only half of a room's occupants. We questioned this with the management but they wouldnâ€™t alter that position. So be warned, if you are booking this hotel to have more than 2 people in a room you will not all get a breakfast unless you pay extra for it whether you think you booked it or not..

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: mish123Ireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in July. Didn't have a car but hotel 15mins walk from subway which didn't bother me but might not suit some. No matter where you stay in LA, you'll be far away from some tourist attraction. It doesn't have a courtesy bus from airport so it means taking the skyride (30mins) and another 30 min subway ride. Only one subway stop from Walk of Fame and its right beside universal studios. Like the hotel, friendly staff, room was lovely and supermarket nearby. Have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids”
Reviews.Author: Heather_and_Jon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights to take in Universal Studios. Great hotel for our girls (12 and 10). Had a family room with a screened bunk bed area which they (and we) loved. Room was good size and very comfortable. We were on the highway side and therefore the balcony was no use, the traffic noise is overwhelming BUT that did not bother us as once the windows were shut we were not disturbed. The pool area was the highlight for the girls and very secure. This meant we could sit in the patio area and relax in the evening. The restaurant food was good and we really enjoyed eating outside. The inside area is unremarkable with too efficient air conditioning. The shuttle to Universal is great but you need to get a ticket from the driver (no one explained this and we missed the first bus as a result). Took a bus to Hollywood Boulevard (horrible place) and a taxi to Rodeo Drive (worth a look). Universal was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, bad AC placement in room”
Reviews.Author: JonnyCanuck99
Reviews.Content: I just finished a 2 night stay here with the family. The hotel is a 10 min drive to Universal Studio's and 20 minutes to Hollywood, so the location is great. The room was nice and clean but we did find somebodies else's old sock behind the dresser when we were settling in, aside from that the room was very clean. There's a nice pool and tennis courts. Parking was $14, but the front desk offered to register me in their points club for free which knocked down the price to $11/night. Wifi was free and worked pretty well. Our major issue with the hotel was the AC unit. We had a two bed room and they place the AC unit literally 16 inches away from one of the beds with the cold air blowing right into your face. For that reason we couldn't turn on the AC at night, but if we left it off we were able to hear the TV in other rooms. We managed to use the AC in "fan" mode, so the white noise killed the sound from the other rooms but the temperature was too warm for comfort. Its a decent hotel and the one bed rooms are probably better, but for a 2 bed room I'd choose a different hotel if I had to return to that area, just because of the AC unit.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SusanM46
Reviews.Content: An easy to find hotel within easy reach of hollywood boulevard and universal studios. Great pool and excellent restaurant, with very well priced and presented food. The only negatives are traffic noise- but rooms well insulated. Great shuttle bus service to nearest tube and Universal Studios. Just watch out for queues at Breakfast time if you are in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location for...”
Reviews.Author: KaceyB
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good location for Hollywood and Universal Studios. Hotel is an older property, but well maintained for the age. My only gripe was the bathroom had no exhaust fan. The bathroom steamed up quickly and paint on ceiling was peeling as a result. But that didn't effect the experience. :) The hotel had a lovely pool area, tennis courts and a nice sand playground for children. Hotel restaurant was ok. Very overpriced for the quality. But just had breakfast there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location a bit on the expensive side”
Reviews.Author: mrbmufc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night while visiting Universal Studios Hollywood. We arrived very early and our room wasn't ready so the hotel stored our bags while we went to Universal. We parked our car here for the rate of $14 a night. The hotel room was very spacious and well kept with a modern feel. Although we didn't use the pool it looked well maintained. The hotel ran a shittle to Universal although we drove. Worth a stay but try to get a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay, but probably would not come back.”
Reviews.Author: Thundergirl990
Reviews.Content: After doing a lot of research to find the best place to stay for a close hotel to Universal Studios, we finally settled on this one because we were able to use our holiday inn points for 3 of the nights we were here. First the pros: Free shuttle to Universal, fairly good location, the pool area/patio area is beautiful. The cons: Almost $200 a night doesn't get you much. No free breakfast, no coffee in the lobby, very few suites available (which really helps when traveling with a teenager who needs his space), loud freeway noise unless you request to change rooms to the tennis court side or patio side of the hotel. The laundry room has one washer and one dryer and was dirty. They don't even replace the shampoo and other toiletry items when you stay more than one night. I had to run down the maid to get another shampoo because we'd used all of ours. Of course, hotels in this area are going to be expensive and noisy (it is a very crowded city!), but still, I found a lot of things lacking at this hotel. We'd just stayed at a Homewood Suites in San Diego that gave us free breakfast, free dinner (Mon. through Thurs.), free coffee all day, little extras that make you feel more welcome. So, this hotel, though they've updated some parts of it seemed pretty "old school" to me. Oh yeah, and we had to pay $11 per night for parking. Ugh.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: PoppyBristol
Reviews.Content: We stayed here whilst in LA for 4 nights and it was great. When we first arrived, we were a little worried that it was a motel kind of place but it really wasn't! The first room we were allocated was on the highway side and noisy but we had no problems moving to a room on the other side - and this was done without complaint and very speedily! The room size was adequate and beds/pillows comfortable. The pool was a great addition and the weather was great so we had a day to relax before we moved on. It is very close to Universal Studios and the hotel provides a free shuttle numerous times a day. We even missed one scheduled pick up time and they came and picked us up straight away when we called. I didn't think much of their cafe/restaurant - food not great and a little overpriced but not a lot of choice around there unless you have a car (which we didn't). We did order in pizza one night without a problem! They also have 2 public computers that you can use for free. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but very soft beds”
Reviews.Author: kevmagee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a road trip and as a stop off for a day at Universal Studios. The family room was great for the four of us (self + spouce + 2 teenagers) but the bed was overly soft and did not contribute to a good nights sleep. The kids enjoyed the pool and we made use of the early and late shuttle bus to Universal. Beware the loud road noise from the nearby freeway so opening the windows is not an option and I thought the car park charges (charged per night) was very cheeky given that the hotel was not in a city centre. Having said that the room had everything we needed with coffee, fridge etc. and we'd consider staying again. Oh - and they could also use some better local maps at reception!

Reviews.Title: “I agreed a rate in advance and they charged 33% extra”
Reviews.Author: allypanton
Reviews.Content: Were very akward to deal with when checking in. I had an issue with card prior to travelling on holiday. The card issue was completely outwith my control and the bank indeed gave me incorrect advice,. All other hotels in the Holiday Inn group honoured my friends and family rate my holiday. The hotel could have contacted me regarding the card issue, but instead just increased the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great trip!”
Reviews.Author: traveller77_10
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly, organised a driver for us so we could get round quickly. Close to universal, have a shuttle bus. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: otrmd
Reviews.Content: Our family vacationed in LA and stayed at your hotel for 4 days. Our stay was quite enjoyable and our sightseeing plans were facilitated by your courteous and friendly staff especially Andy, Joseph and Fred. We will certainly stay at this hotel again on our next visit and will recommend it to our friends who plan on visiting L.A. W especially liked the free shuttle service. For tips on what to see and how to get around, the lady at the gift shop was also very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, also had problem with man at desk...”
Reviews.Author: ShooneJameson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while on a trip to LA. It was VERY convenient and close enough to the main sites, roads, Burbank airport, etc... my ONLY problem on the WHOLE trip was the man at the front desk (another recent review mentions him also). Let me say, there were a few young guys working there also who were quite nice. Whenever I saw them alone, we would joke together about how much of an ***hole the other guy was and I think they said he was the MANAGER!!!! Seriously, he was VERY rude, short, and offered no extra assistance of ANY kind. In fact, I wanted to AVOID speaking to him as much as possible to resist wanting to "get into something" with him due to his rudeness. If you check-in this hotel, you'll notice him, he's the older-looking guy at the front desk, and is a complete pain in the you know what! Other than that, it was a pleasant stay, although I told myself I WOULD NOT return to that hotel again because of HIM alone. If he's the manager, then I will not give him my business.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: francesvk
Reviews.Content: We had our 12 year old grandson with us and our room had two queen beds. The hotel was conveniently located to Universal, Warner Studios and the freeway. We stayed for a week and would definitely go back in the future. Our room was in the Portello which is the smaller building and it was very quiet and private. The room was clean and the only negative was the desk chair location. If you were at the desk, a person going to the washroom had difficulty getting behind the chair which was too big for the area. The hotel could also use a larger laundry room with more washers and dryers. There was only one washer and one dryer and always in use until the late hours into the night. Up the street is a laundromat which is where we did our wash. We paid $11 per day for parking which is pricey. The restaurant is on the premises and the prices were reasonable. All in all, it was a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, but a bit lost in the Hills”
Reviews.Author: ShiverZ66
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel on a trip with my sister, we had booked this hotel hoping it was to be in the centre of LA, unfortunately, it was not. It was at least an hours taxi drive from LAX airport and another 30 minutes bus ride to get into Hollywood. Despite saying this, it was right next to Universal Studios. This was a plus point as we did want to visit the theme park and the hotel does run a FREE coach there and back from the park - BONUS. The hotel room was pleasant and clean, the beds were comfortable and the room was very spacious! There was a big screen tv and an ice machine just down the hall. The bathroom was great, despite the shower being very painfully powerful, but it was clean and spacious. There was a balcony, but with a free-way nearby, it was anything but peaceful. This can easily be solved once inside the room, as the balcony door is sound proof. The downfall to the room was that there were no curtains, just netting infront of the window for privacy, which caused a problem when there was an irritating green light shining into our room (I think it was a sign advertising the hotel?) and took us a while to get used to when trying to sleep. The staff seemed quite grumpy at times and the two ladies from in the gift shop we asked advice and directions about the area, gave us the wrong information, leading us to not reach certain sights we wanted to see. This hotel is not built for those who have not rented their own car, my sister and I can drive, but chose not to as we were on holiday. The public transport was terrible, as you had to get a bus or taxi anywhere. Buses were cheap, but quite unreliable at times.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and updated with great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Tslammer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights July 3rd and 4th. Room was very nice and seemed recently updated. Great location only a couple miles from Hollywood blvd and universal studios. They had nighlty movies showing at the pool on a big screen, with a small bar to grab a beverage if you wanted. The pool area has a outdoor firepit (gas) to warm up after a dip in the pool, you could also order room service from the pool area. We were worried about highway noise but did not find that a problem. The area seemed safe and there is a grocery store and places to eat with in walking distance. We did not try the restaurant on site, but menu looked good. We drove up Ventura Blvd one night and ate at Panera and saw Billy Ray Cyrus there on the forth, made our trip. I would stay here again in a heart beat. Parking is 14 dollars a Day, which seems to be the norm in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Californian treasure at a great price”
Reviews.Author: sammyjo_77
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week at the Beverley Garland Holiday Inn in North Hollywood. I got the hotel on a deal with Travelocity Top Secret and was delighted. I travelled with 2 children age 8 and 11 and was there to do the sites and see friends. The hotel has had a recent refurb and the public areas are trendy and fresh with a californian styling. Lovely pool area with hot tub which the kids loved. Full dining available and smart outdoor chill out patio area. Rooms were clean and functional. Ours was in the block at the back which only had a carpark view but was quiet and had a balcony.- there was another block with rooms overlooking the pool and patio areas too which were probably the same inside but you pay more for the view. Free wifi was great and there was also a small free business area with printer. The hotel also had a free shuttle service which takes you to and from Universal Studios and the Universal City Walk - it also stopped at the metro but we didn't use that. Staff were helpful and very friendly. There is a walkable supermarket but the hotel has a little shop which was ideal for room bits and pieces. On site restaurant and bar. We just had breakfast in the restaurant which was buffet style and plentiful. The hotel was very relaxing after manic days spent out and about. I would definitely recommend it and would use it as a base for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place.”
Reviews.Author: sbocajaerdna
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in June. There is a shuttle bus from here to Universal Studios that is free. Apart from that the location is approximately a 15 minute drive from the hotel to Hollywood Boulevard and longer to everywhere else. Be aware that they charge for parking $14 a night. Apart from that this is a large, clean hotel. The facilities are good, nice rooms, comfortable bed, good shower, swimming pool. As for complaints about the noise from the road, we didnt have any trouble at all. Also, be aware that breakfast is not included in the price. For the price, this is a good deal in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old hollywood feel”
Reviews.Author: hollywoodchookie
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, had a nice "old hollywood" feel to it, when we walked into the room it was a very 'warm and welcoming' feeling with great lighting and feel. Bed was extremly comfortable, great TV cable programming and bathroom. It had a great restaurant on the premisis where we had breaky and dinner a few times. The only letdown was the reception staff, they weren't really interested in us and just wanted to get us in and out but apart from that was great!

Reviews.Title: “Very near to Universal Studois”
Reviews.Author: Punjabi007
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 4 . Hotel has good location only if you are visiting Universal studios. Otherwise it on a busy highway & there is hardly any dining options( restaurant) within walking distance ( except the Restuarant in the Hotel) Free shuttle to Universal Studios is punctual & conventient. Free internet is a bonus. Our bathroom had a blocked sink, also the exhaust fan in the bathroom was permanently `on' - could not be swiched off , & made noise at night - I complained at the front desk but nothing happened. Our Room did not have any fridge or safety locker ( I had to use the locker at the reception). Apart from these problems it was a nice stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hollywood base”
Reviews.Author: WorcsMidlandman
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 nights here. Excellent value hotel, swimming pool never crowded plenty of beds, Staff very helpful and friendly. Close to Universal Studios,free shuttle from hotel. Metro or private hire best way to see sights. Check for fixed price when booking private hire. Lovely comfortable rooms, a pleasure to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and unpleasant!”
Reviews.Author: CheshireHighFlyer
Reviews.Content: I was surprised being a Holiday Inn hotel that it was so poor. The room was facing the highway so the noise was incessant. Despite being a non-smoking room it stank of stale smoke and damp. The room was also poorly cleaned. The only good thing going for this hotel was it's location to Universal Studio!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Beware of Online Offers That Are Less Than They Seem!”
Reviews.Author: TrustbutVerify
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. It's retro, 1950s and 60s, but clean and well-kept. The grounds communicate rest and relaxation even though the hotel is near the hum of a major highway. The hotel is apparently still owned by the family of the late Beverly Garland, which gives it a genuine Hollywood connection. The breakfast buffet at the hotel is pricey ($18+) but first-rate (and kids eat free). On the downside, you pay for parking, and service at the front desk can be SLOW (even if there isn't a line). One more thing: Beware of the special offers on the hotel's website. They may not be what they seem! Thinking of returning to the hotel with my family, I recently booked a Best-4-Breakfast rate that the website claimed was bundled with their breakfast buffet. But after I actually confirmed the reservation, I noticed small print on the confirmation page saying that actually each room gets one coupon worth $20. If you are staying there alone, that is just barely enough to pay for the breakfast buffet plus tax. But if you have your spouse with you, this coupon isn't going to provide a breakfast buffet for both people in the room. I just confirmed this by calling the reservation line. I consider the hotel's description of this rate is HIGHLY misleading. In my experience, "Breakfast" rates typically mean breakfast for everyone in the room, or at least for two people in double-occupancy rooms--not breakfast for only one person. The reservation person said she would communicate my concern to management. It will be interesting to see if the hotel corrects its website. Since this "breakfast" rate does not actually include breakfast for more than one person, the "savings" of this rate is non-existent. You will save more money by ordering a single room and then ordering breakfast separately, especially if you are a member of a group like AAA that gets a room discount.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel close to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: DeeLittleHobo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in May as part of a multi-city vacation in California and Nevada. We chose the Beverly Garland based on other reviews and were not disappointed. The hotel is situated in North Hollywood, close to Universal Studios which is only a 5 minute drive away. The hotel has a minivan which takes guests and picks them up from Universal Studios; this service is free and we used it without any problems. The staff we encountered were all very nice and helpful including LaTanya who works in the gift shop and the waiter in the restaurant (I think his name was Milo?). The rooms are comfortable and clean with good quality linens and towels. There was no in-room safe but it is possible to "hire" a safe in the business centre by the hotel lobby. Basically you pay a deposit for the safe key (I believe this was $25) and get it back when you return the key at the end of your stay. There is free wi-fi in the room (you need to ask the staff for an access code). There is a good sized pool and hot tub plus a sauna and a gym. The pool area is really nice and there is even a fireplace which is especially handy when you have a dip after dark and you feeling a little bit chilly after getting out of the water. The pool area is open till 10pm. There is also a laundy room on the lower ground floor of one of the buildings with a coin operated washer and dryer. You will need quarters for these, about $1.25 for the wash and $1 for the dryer (or vice versa - cannot remember). It costs $14 a day to park in this hotel. I believe this is the norm with many Los Angeles hotels especially ones near tourist attractions. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would recommend it without hesitation. My one word of advice is to ask for a room that does not face the freeway (if you are a light sleeper). The first room we were offered faced the freeway and I knew straight away that this would not work for me. We went down to lobby again and asked for a room change, which they did graciously and without any hassle. We will return to the Beverly Garland.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: redwhitetj
Reviews.Content: Either my wife or myself have stayed here 8 times within the last year. The rates are reasonable, and the rooms are clean. The pool is great and the restaurant is good. The rooms are not as fancy or as updated as some hotels, but for the price it can't be beat. We have paid about 150 per night for each stay. It is within walking distance of many restaurants and a grocery store and pharmacy. It is convenient to Studio City, North Hollywood, and Burbank. The only draw back is the highway just north of the hotel. Ask for a room with a balcony that does not face the highway.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms, Great Location, Nice Pool & Facilities, Good Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: ctunnell
Reviews.Content: The location is easy to get to and within walking distance of many restaurants as well as a grocery store. Clean rooms with nice balcony views as well as good lounging areas/ pool. Tula's restaurant is affordable and has some of the best, freshest food I've eaten at a hotel while traveling. Most items $20 or less on dinner menu! They also have a pretty nice fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ruebie
Reviews.Content: We were here for a short vacation, had a great time. The hotel's decor is beautiful, and the rooms are nice and roomy. The staff very helpful and nice. There is a shuttle that takes you to Universal Hollywood, City Walk , no charge. There is a hot tub, pool, fitness center, and a great resturant. Waht more can you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: jillybean123_10
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at this hotel. Very friendly and accomodating staff. Loved the shuttle!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, friendly staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: littled85
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn Universal Studio for a week in May. The room had 2 double beds, big LCD TV with wide choice of channels. Also have free broadband WiFi internet which was really fast and stable connection. Bathroom was clean and good size. There was no shower gel provided but this is not a major issue. The hotel has swimming pool, jacuzzi and fitness centre where towels are provided. We had breakfast and dinner in Tula's Cafe. Breakfast was nice and they have buffet or you can choose from A La Carte menu. Prices were reasonable. Dinner was good as well but a bit overpriced. The hotel itself located in North Hollywood. There is free shuttle bus to Universal Studio (5 minutes away). If you have a car you have to pay for parking $14 per day. (which is kinda cheap compare to other hotels). Hollywood Walk of Fame is 10mins drive away from the hotel, Beverly Hills about 15mins, LAX Airport 25-30mins. I had no problems with noise and things like this mentioned in previous reviews.... Staff were very friendly and I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID ROOM 119”
Reviews.Author: tired_n_grumpy_in_LA
Reviews.Content: Last weekend we stayed at the holiday Inn Beverly Garland universal studios in LA and were highly disappointed with the room! We were in room 119 and the noise from the bathroom in the room above was terrible, we could hear the toilet seat being dropped, the toilet being used and then when the bathtub was being used the water sounded like a waterfall, that was just the first night! After this I requested some ear plugs from reception and was told that I could go get them from the gift shop! We hoped it was a one off and the room may be empty on the second night, no such luck again early in the morning the noise woke us up, when you are on vacation you donâ€™t need to be disturbed like this! The third morning was the worst, around 0700hrs the noise started, but around 0730hrs when the shower was in use there was a noise that sounded like a drill being used, we put it down to the massage on the shower being used, I rang reception to ask if they could stop it but never heard back from them! This early awakening really did ruin our day! When we discussed this with the reception desk they werenâ€™t aware of the call we had made earlier that morning, when we explained the noises we heard they said that engineering had been to unblock a drain at 0730hrs on a Sunday morning, surely it could have waited! We moved to another room for the final night, it was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Ideal”
Reviews.Author: Occasional_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed in May 2010 for a vacation. Enjoyed the friendly service and location. Tula's Cafe was an excellent option for breakfast and supper. (didn't do lunch there). No noise issues for us. Tennis courts were a bonus at this price level. Lots of room on site. Next trip to California will involve this hotel. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a bit too noisy”
Reviews.Author: lizzylg
Reviews.Content: When we arrive at almost 5pm, check-in was 3pm, they told us they were not sure if the room was ready yet. The staff were not that friendly except for the men/porters that drive the shuttles to Universal Studios and they were after a tip all the time. They also try to sell you LA tours every time they see you coming. We ended up going down to Hollywood Boulevard and a company offered us pretty much the same tour for about 1 third of the price so don't waste your money booking through the hotel. You can also get around using the Metro system as well, the bus stops outside the hotel and the train is a short walk from the hotel. It is a great location for Universal Studios and there is a free shuttle from the hotel to there. We had a kids suite, the room had been renovated which was nice but it had an adjoining door to another room which was made out of paper almost as we could hear everything the family in the next room was saying and their TV which was annoying. Also, the kids suite is right next to the freeway which is very noisy. That was also annoying as the kids suite costs quite a bit more than the standard room and it is in the noisiest part of the hotel. The kids suite really just has a little wall around bunk beds, my son liked it though, he thought it was fun. It costs you however to use the games in the room. Also, there is an extra TV in the kids area but it is about 3 metres from the main TV so very hard to have on at the same time! The main bed was only comfortable with 1 person in it otherwise you felt like you were rolling down a hill all night. We had dinner at Tula's cafe a couple of nights and it was very nice and the prices reasonable, the staff were friendly there. I would recommend it if you are going to Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok nothing to rave about”
Reviews.Author: jennw_10
Reviews.Content: Ok let me first start by saying i did not pick this hotel a travel agent did, however on a good note before i write my complants it was pretty clean, besides the blood stains or maybe choclate on our sheets the first night ,,,,,,it was myself and 2 other girls the room had 2 beds a desk and 2 sinks so it worked out well, the pool area is very nice fire place and couches around the area also a hot tub so no compents there, however we had a rental car that we paid for through our travel agent and the hotel charges 15.00 a day t0 park your car there WHY??? i am staying in your hotel, so 50.00 in fees for a spot at the hotel we were staying in was ridiculous , secondly the location sucked everything was freeway driving 45mins, to an hour to get to sunset blvd, venice beach, or to any bar which again sucked,,,,mapquest tells you 20mins untill u sit in crazy traffic for 45mins and we had no choice this location was not in walking distance to anywhere oh dont let me forget my favorite you are no allowed to ciggarettes on and outside balcony ,but you are allowed to smoke "pot" in your room that we had to smell everyday,,,,please explain this to me i cant seem to understand that one, also the housekeepers were the ones who felt the need to inform the hotel managemment we smoked on a balcony "outside" yet not one day did they knock on our door to clean or give towels we had to ask them to do it wtf is that lol ridiculous ,,,, and one more thing the management couldnt be ruder the old man who works the front desk with the gray hair is the most misrable man i have ever met no smile no hello and when you needed something from the front desk like a peice of scotch tape he made you feel like you were a bother to him,,,,,with all this being said i personally will never stay at beverly garlnads hotel LA however i will visit just would stay somewhere else ,,,,,,,

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: pinksmum
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and loved it. The staff were very friendly and knowledgable, the fitness center was well stocked and the pool was great, even when the air was cold the water was well heated and the fireplace was nice to sit next to to dry off. We used the free shuttle service to Universal and then used our rental car to get around, maps and directions provided by the front desk! We ate breakfast in the hotel every morning had dinner one night, the food was plentiful, good value for money and tasty and the waiting staff very attentive. Overall i would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: shigson
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great spot for all the sites and room was very clean and comfortable if a little on the small side. Were expecting a fridge in the room but when we got there we found that it would cost $10 per day to hire one! Would have also welcomed an in-room safe. Had a lovely balcony with a table and 2 chairs, but the noise from the freeway was too loud to enjoy it. Wasnâ€™t too bad when the patio doors were closed and curtains drawn and we didnâ€™t find it a problem sleeping, but the balcony was unusable which was a shame. The hotel had a very nice pool area with a jacuzzi and an outdoor fireplace â€“ handy as the pool area was open until 10pm each evening. It was just a shame that we didnâ€™t get time to utilise it. The $14 per day parking fee was hard to swallow, especially as on one of the days we visited the Six Flags park and had to pay another $15 to park our car there as well! Shuttle bus was handy, but only ran at certain times and the last one back from the City Walk to the hotel was at 9pm so it would mean a taxi ride home if you wanted to stay out later (or a 25 min walk). Didnâ€™t eat in the hotel, but did eat at the nearby City Wok (turn left out of hotel and walk for about 10 mins to Ventura boulevard), which was fantastic. Cheap, but excellent food and large portions (and we only had the half portions!) and clearly popular with locals. Just pay $1 more and ask for white meat if you prefer chicken breast in your dish.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindaOB
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 3 nights in this hotels during our recent trip to California. Rooms are good size if perhaps a little dated. Staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Very close to Universal Studios, we took the free shuttle provided by the hotel. There is a metro station close by but we took the bus into Hollywood Blvd which went from accross the road from the hotel, very straightforward and managed to get it back again that night. We ate breakfast on the three mornings and dinner one evening in the hotel restaurant (situated beside hotel) and found this to be very good and well priced. Overall the hotel is very good, the only things that caused us any concern was the noise coming from the freeway nearby, found it quite difficult to sleep although this could have also had something to do with the time change. Would definitely recommend this hotel but would try to get a room as far away from the freeway as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Employees and very helpful”
Reviews.Author: Vega44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Beverly Garland Holiday Inn to recoup from surgery and the staff was so helpful and kind. I had the full support of everyone from the Manager, to the front desk staff, housekeeping, room service, bell desk and even the gift shop employess. I wont stay any where else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: perseus9
Reviews.Content: I can't speak highly enough about this hotel. Everything was perfect and it's an excellent value with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: Davesito
Reviews.Content: The rooms were immaculately cleaned every day, the lobby was nice, there is a restaurant on-site, and the staff was very helpful when I needed to spend an extra day. One day it rained, and the staff put in the lobby a dozen or so umbrellas. The hotel is within walking distance of Universal Studios and a metro station, but they provide shuttle bus service anyways. The Fitness Center was the nicest I've ever seen in any hotel. It's a big fitness center with three treadmills and other machines, weights, clean towels and a water cooler. All the equipment is new and functioning properly. Each treadmill has its own television with ear plugs so you don't annoy the other guests. It's near a highway, but you would never know. It's very quitet.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: pktchr61
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you can imagine. We go back there every year bcause they feel like "family". The hotel is immaculate. They have the nicest employees, all the way from housekeeping, room service to the maintenance people. Everybody there kept asking us if there was anything they could do to make our stay there more pleasureable. They have a great pool, spa, playground for the kids, and tennis courts. Thank you to all the employees there for making our stay there one we will never forget. P.S. Can't wait to see Mr. Seneca, the General Manager all of his wonderful staff again next year!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel with a recent makeover that has great service!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_GDevonUK
Reviews.Content: This is an older Holiday inn, that must of been done up recently, although still seem a bit dated in places, but this was not a problem the rooms have plenty of space and are clean and well kept, and also a balcony if you want to take in the sun. Down side of the Balcony was that the noise came though the door even when closed and curtains drawn. Bathroom was good, clean and had all of the usual items you would need on your trip. Staff were very helpful, hotel shuttle bus ran frequent trips to Univeral studios, so no need to use your car once checked in. Parking was $11 per day but this seemed in line with most hotels in the area. On site was a nice pool area, small shop, and a small restarant. We didnt eat any evening meals here just the Breakfast buffet which was Â£13.00 but when you worked out the cost of all the items on offer it was a fantastic offer. (just remember if your doing the rides at universal dont go crazy on the buffet!!!) Overall a great hotel! Oh and free internet available in your room!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Beverley Garland Hotel and staff were the best and we've been about.”
Reviews.Author: holipeople
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. When we arrived we thought we were miles away from all the glitz and glamour yet it was only a 10mins ride on the bus, bus stop just outside the hotel door. I have a walking disability and everything was fantastic and easy accessible. The meals and bar area are also fantastic and the largest best value for money meals in the area. I couldn't believe the pool area and that we were swimming at 8pm and lying in the heated spa, watching the stars, then sitting next to the large poolside fire. This was fantastic. I feel a bit bad that I could not remember the staff's names but we moved on to San Francisco after that. The blonde haired lady in the shop was so helpful and gave us great tips on what to do the first night we arrived and booked our transport back to the airport with no hassle. Thomas in the bar was fantastic, he didn't need to ask what room you were in, he knew everyone, room number and what they drank. The receptionist was also very helpful and very smart with a lovely smile, her name was La something, again we should have taken the names as we were at 3 hotels that holiday and this was far the best, in fact I think it's one of the best in our travels. Definately a yes for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but too much freeway noise”
Reviews.Author: seedlady
Reviews.Content: Pros: The best thing about this hotel was the location. It is close to all LA sightseeing opportunities. The second best was the value. We booked through Hotwire for $75 / night. The grounds are very nice and the pool looked gorgeous, though it was too cold to use during our stay in January. A nice touch is the outdoor fireplace near the pool that was lit every evening. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. They will give you bottled water at the front desk. Cons: Our King room seemed small to me and the block wall construction was blah. Sounds from the freeway right next to the hotel kept us awake our first night but we also live in a place where it's very quiet at night. The parking fee was an added annoyance but we got the room so cheap on Hotwire that it was still a good value. This hotel is in a great location so I would consider using it again but will ask for a room that is away from the freeway side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nicole2906
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights at the end of honeymoon. We were upgraded to a larger room when we checked in. The room was a great size, had a fridge, coffee making facilities, balcony, large TV. The hotel was fairly close to Universal and the train station was only about a ten minute walk away from the hotel. We were given fresh towels and the room was cleaned every day. The only problem was we were in a room at the end of the corridor next to a service room so it was a bit noisy sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice economic hotel”
Reviews.Author: somu_traveller
Reviews.Content: Excellent economic Hotel.Good value for money.Friendly staff.They also have a complimentary buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “realy nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: diananimagoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel to make a trip to universal studio with my kids. This is a wonderful place for kids and adults alike, and for the price well worth it. The parking is a pain and costs 14 dollars but other than that the service is good the room service is a good price better than some I have seen. We got a season pass for universal so we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: lsprouse
Reviews.Content: This ended up being a great place to stay for our quick weekend this past December. We went to visit our daughter who lives in Hollywood and we had not stayed in the area before. It was close and convenient to freeway yet quiet. The hotel staff were great. The rooms were clean and comfortable and have been recently remodeled. It is an older hotel, but with remodel it was updated and decorated nicely. They had it decorated beautifully for the holidays in lobby and on grounds. The restaraunt next door was great for breakfast each morning. I would recommend this hotel to others who are in the area and want a convenient, clean and affordable accomadation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: anitajd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beverly Garland Holiday Inn for one night, Dec. 23rd. Our party included 2 adults, 2 8-yr old boys and a 5-yr old boy. I had reserved a room with 2 queen beds. Upon check-in, Angel, the desk clerk, informed me I was "Guest of the Day"! She presented me with a gift bag of goodies (2 water bottles, M&Ms, almonds), a certificate, and A ROOM UPGRADE!! to a "children's room suite." The room was a regular-sized room with a king bed, but Holiday Inn built a "room" around a bunk-bed with it's own dresser and TV. The "room" looked like a fort or a castle. How perfect for little boys/kids? I thought the "Guest of the Day" promotion idea is absolutely fantastic as a way to promote guest-loyalty! The room was clean, the bathroom was clean, the employees were very helpful. the decor was very contemporary. My only "minor" complaint was that our room was located on the first floor, and at about midnight or so, employees on a shift change or break, were being loud outside our room. Not a big deal. I heard them, but *not* the highway traffic nearby. And although breakfast was not included in the price of the room, our children did eat free. And the parking was free as well. I would definitely stay here or recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent restaurant, friendly & helpful staff. We will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Homelovingirl
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay for a trip to Universal Studios or Downtown LA. Easy to get downtown either by taxi or bus. Staff all courteous and helpful. Food in adjacent restaurant was superb.

Reviews.Title: “A Magic Location”
Reviews.Author: Beehcroft
Reviews.Content: Every two years we fly from the UK to attend a Conference on Magic History. now in it's eleventh year. This year we noticed that the ideally sirtuated hotel had received a makeover with a new welcoming lobby and seating area transforming the old gift shop and offices that had been re located. A great improvement and added bonus. There was additional outdoor seating too, where the old grassy area. The attentive staff were, as usual, excellent, and Jeff on the font desk even remembered us from the previous visit in 2007. Great service! If you have a young family and need to visit Universal Studios then this is the ideal location. We can't wait for the next Conference in 2011 but would plan to stay should we visit again meantime.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Kimba_Kutie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn when we travel to LA. It's conveniently located near Universal Studios and easy access to the freeway and Hollywood. It's clean and comfortable. We like the rooms facing the courtyard in the Eldorado Building. You get your own private balcony. I would highly recommend this hotel to solo travelers and families alike. The only drawback, be prepared to pay $14 a day for parking in their lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Have a Meeting”
Reviews.Author: Scooter106
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to have a meeting, the staff is great and there are so many different things to see after the day is done with business. I would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Hospitable”
Reviews.Author: caadmin
Reviews.Content: Hotel building and staff exemplify old Hollywood hospitality and courtesy. Rooms clean and well appointed. The hotel staff courteous and helpful. Very enjoyably stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fall at the Beverly Garland - Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: miss_shallot
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn for 7 days in September on our vacation. The staff were so helpful and kind. The hotel atmosphere was outstanding it is surrounded by beautiful trees, the grounds and pool area are well kept, the common areas were nicely decorated and very clean, the rooms were comfortable and and nicely appointed. We enjoyed the balcony and the wonderful views. The food in the cafe is great and affordably priced. We took advantage of the free shuttle to Universal Studios.City Walk. All the sites of Hollywood are so close. If you don't want to drive in LA, you can take the Metro. We definetely will be returning on vacation next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnergyBelfast
Reviews.Content: Really good sized, well equipped rooms. Nice pool & jacuzzi - had a very good stay here. Restaurant food wasn't great though.

Reviews.Title: “Yhis is a reallyawesome hotel.”
Reviews.Author: THECATNC
Reviews.Content: The rooms hbere were of a nice size and very clean. The beds were very comfortable and I slept as well here as I did at home. I liked the idea that you could not get into the building with the rooms without a key card. The grounds were very neat and with all the trees was very relaxing. As for the staff I don't think that I saw anyone who was not trying to be very helpful. They acdt like they really enjoy what they are doing. The location was great as far as being near attractions especially in the Hollywood area. Very enjoyable stay and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that was clean and comfortable, with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: heref0rd1
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for a week at this hotel and were really pleased with the room we were allocated. It was nice to have a balcony to relax on and free Wifi was a bonus. The staff were so courteous, friendly and helpful with particular thanks to the ladies in the gift shop who helped us to find our way around. Having no car, transport needed a bit of planning but the free bus to Universal Studios was a big plus and the same bus would drop off and pick up at the Metro. The cafe was excellent both for snacks and meals and the pool area was lovely. We could have done without two days of rain as we can see that in England but it was very warm rain!

Reviews.Title: “Finer Accomodations You Will Not Find”
Reviews.Author: eventsiam
Reviews.Content: I've traveled for over 2 decades and BG's staff and accommodations are exemplary! You will not find more attentive staff anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, awesome rooms, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: rosepetal56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn for 10 days in September on our vacation. The hotel is surrounded by beautiful trees and the grounds are very well kept up. The rooms are very conformable and we enjoyed the balcony. The food in the cafe is great and it's not expensive. The staff were so helpful and kind. We took advantage of the free shuttle to Universal Studios.City Walk. All the sites of Hollywood are so close. If you don't want to drive in LA, you can take the Metro. We definetely will be returning on vacation next year!

Reviews.Title: “My family loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cinz123
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Beverly Garland. Nice rooms with a balcony, not brand new but very nice. Close to Citywalk. The pool area was large with comfy seats. The coctail lounge was beautiful and cozy with a fire. The onsite restaurant was very good. We will definately stay here again when we are in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: ejohn75
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Beverly Garland and were very impressed. The rooms are quiet and clean. The staff is very friendly. It is a great home base to explore Hollywood and the greater LA area. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “very tired and overpriced for what is offered”
Reviews.Author: Misspiggy21
Reviews.Content: Just returned form 2 weeks in america and stayed here for the last 3 nights. We checked in at 4.30 pm and when we got to the room it was still not ready. So we moved to another room. Every day we had to ask for extra toweles as the housekeeping left only two towels. The room is a very standard small size, the beds are old and the publisised pillow choice selection is poor as the pillows are some of the worst we encountered on our trip. The bathroom is very small and has a real stench from the sink. The rooms need a refurb urgently. Room service was delivered cold but after some dispute it was removed from ther bill. On checkout we were granted a late checkout only to return and not be able to get into our room, went to get the problem rectified and then the carpark would not let us out on leaving. The front desk staff were ok but really seemed as though they could not have cared less. Overall, ok if you are happy with basic service with no enthusiasm, and a very basic room. No we would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Donna529
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms, one for my husband and me and one for my in-laws. This is not a new hotel, but one that is extremely well maintained. Being older, the walls are thicker and we never overheard noise from ajoining rooms. All the fountains were running, and at night the miniature lights were lit and fireplaces burning. You need your room card to get into the building as well as your room, so it was secure. Our rooms were very clean. One time we came back to the room to find the maid smoothing out the bedsheets so they lay perfectly flat. We ate breakfast there almost every morning. The food was very good and our waitress Sonia was the best! This hotel is located at a great location. It is convenient to everything. 10 min to Burbank airport, 10 min to Hollywood Blvd, 20 to Pasadena, not too far from the beaches and 30 min to Disneyland (on weekends) and 90 min to Santa Barbara for wine tasting!

Reviews.Title: “Great California Experience”
Reviews.Author: jmwatkins
Reviews.Content: A friend and I traveled to Hollywood and stayed in this hotel. It was a quaint, comfortable shady getaway in the midst of a city. We enjoyed the fireplace and lifesize ottomans while! lounging in the pool area. Most of all the customer service was excellent. The people in the front desk area and housekeepers went out of their way to make it a great stay. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - no problems”
Reviews.Author: wjw1321
Reviews.Content: Hotel fine - no problems, staff very friendly. Although its quiet with nothing to do at night time. A 15 minute walk away is a good supermarket and a couple of restaurants but no nightlife as such here at all. You can get a Metro bus right outside the hotel (no 156) which takes you directly to Hollywood and the Chinese Threatre which is where the hand/foot prints are on the pavements, at a cost of $1.25. Staff dont tell you of this service and try to get you to take the tourist buses. The Metro system is excellent and every bus or train is $1.25 per trip or get a day ticket at the train station for $5 which can be used on both buses and trains. Free WiFi in your room if you have your laptop. No fridge in rooms. Only bug bear for us was the lack of safes for said laptop etc, there are tiny security boxes at reception which I couldnt even get my travelling jewellery box into. There are 8 large security boxes big enough for latops but they are on a first come first served basis, so getting one in the first place is difficult and when anyone does they hogg it until the end of their stay (me included). Buffet breakfast in hotel is nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - a gem”
Reviews.Author: davidnumber9
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Only a in-room safe and maybe a fridge would improve it. Free safe available near reception. Fridge available at 10 dollars per day. Pool good, jacuzzi hot. Free internet and printer next to reception. Free sauna and excellent fitness centre. Free shuttle to Universal which came and collected us after we missed the designated depart time. Would definately recommend and return to this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday for Tourists - Definitely would go back!”
Reviews.Author: Borsiniman
Reviews.Content: Stayed hrere for 5 nights. Excellent hotel, good clean comfortable rooms. Staff very helpful, friendly and efficient. After the first day most staff would address you by name. We took breakfast some days in the restaurant - excellent buffet and service. Outdoor heated swimming pool. Locatedsome 2/3 miles from Hollywood and 1 mile from Universal Studios. If you don't have a car, the hotel mininbus ran regulary to Universal and would drop you off at the adjacent Metro subway station/Bus Station Or taxis were reasonably cheap. Would thouroughly recommend and definitely stay there agin in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for universal studios”
Reviews.Author: Daisy123Lancashire
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were greeted by the very friendly concierge who told us about the sight seeing trip the hotel did. We signed up to this and it was totally worth it. Saw all the sights and since the hotel is quite away from the LA 'sights' we got to see everything we wanted. Glad we didnt drive it ourself. The room was comfy and had everything we needed. The next day we went to universal studios - hotel has a free shuttle bus which drops you off at the entrance - again super. The pool is amazing - relaxing! Hotel has a shop and coffee bar on sight. Hotel bar and restaurant were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for business or pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: sufuller
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean. All of the staff that I dealt with were very friendly and polite. There is a restaurant, bar, store and pool with fireplace. The rooms have balconies for you to sit out on and enjoy your coffee. The location is perfect - very accessible from either Burbank or LAX. It was a great vacation that my whole family enjoyed. Will defintely be back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Classic elegance and rich history”
Reviews.Author: RKOhio
Reviews.Content: Modern conveniences and classic Hollywood style. Excellent service and short shuttle (complimentary) to Universal Studios, however the bed left could have been much more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: MB123England
Reviews.Content: MB&SB Oswestry England. Stayed here in Sept 08 for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon road trip. We chose this hotel based on reviews on tripadvisor and its locality to Universal Studios. Hotel very pleasent. The hotel rooms are clean and well maintained. The bar to unwind in is great and the american breakfasts are to die for in the cafe next door which is part of the hotel complex. Loads of choice and you can go up for seconds or even thirds. Great food at a great price. Pool area looked great but didnt have time to try it out. The hotel runs a complimentary bus service to Universal which is literally 5 to 10 min max away depending on traffic. Hotel staff very helpful and couldnt do enough for us whenever we had a question. Would recommend this hotel for short stays. Next time we are in LA we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very average.. not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: SONNYSMOM
Reviews.Content: I expected so much more for this place especially for the price, which the rate I booked at cost me 50 bucks more then I had orginally planned.. this place was over 200 a night, for that you can stay at the universal sheraton which is walking distance to universal studios. The staff was not friendly nor rude, and i felt like a) I needed to be a movie star or someone famous or b) didnt seem like I had enough money for this place. They have a shuttle, which is poorly organized and always full and they do not run them enough for the large amount of guest at this hotel. The room was so-so, the beds were comfy but the shower was nice, with good smelling stuff they give you. There is no fridge or microwave, and room service only goes til ten at night so I cant rate that. Tula's was expensive for what you got (dennys type food) and the service was slow and the waiters rude! They obviously want you to get the buffet, which was standard continental, which you get free at very many other hotels, but was on the pricey side, and more expensive than the dishes on the menu. If they want you too order that, then they need to make it cheaper than the other breakfast's. They also boast on the website that kids eat free.. but then they dont give the kids a kids menu so they have to order the adults meal, and then the free meal doesnt apply. I didnt think the rooms were noisy, in fact our room had double glass doors but then I find the sound of the freeway relaxing and a part of vacation. If you want to get around this area, use the subway and busses if you are without a car, its cheaper and easy to get around do the research before you go! the metro redline takes you and connects you almost everywhere! they also push you to take one of the hollywood tours (which will cost you 60 to 100 bucks) , which after being charged 100 bucks more for my stay I couldnt afford. we went and walked around hollywood and found a tour company offering seats for 20 bucks! Overall, I didnt hate the place, but didnt love it, and thought it was too expensive for the stay, so only stay here if you get a good rate, and make sure that rate is secure before you book!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: teddy_scot
Reviews.Content: Great , clean comfortable hotel with easy access to Universal and freeway. Friendly staff, Pool and fitness centre, Gift shop with helpful staff. Free internet in the business centre. $15 a night Parking. Not the dearest in my experience. Would defenitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “only average”
Reviews.Author: Brown9
Reviews.Content: Excellent locartion,close to Universal and hollywood.Roomy, clean and quiet free, shuttle to Universal. Did not like the cost of parking, wifi,breakfast.Also did not like the fact that they did not explain the ease of use of the near by subway.They did not keep discount coupons and were very pushy to sell us organised tours.and expansive tickets We were missing constantly shampoo,soaps etc... To summarise: only average with important pros but many faults as well. too expansive for what that was offered

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, parking and internet cost you extra.”
Reviews.Author: W-Flemish-Traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, the room clean, the staff friendly. No complaints on that. To bad in the city you always have to pay extra for parking and Wifi while the price is already higher then a nice countryside motel. Location is very good, close to the freeway and close to Warner Bros, Universal, Hollywood. Far from the airport though.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to Universal”
Reviews.Author: LTS1Bournemouth
Reviews.Content: Had numerous problems with the booking prior to arrival, which a member of staff at the hotel dealt with very efficiently , and upgraded the room to an executive suite complimentary. The room was very spacious and really nice. Was really pleased with the upgrade! The hotel is very close to Universal Studios, and a free shuttle is offered, which was great. Its actually in a quite a good location, did not take long to drive to all the tourist locations. LA is amazing, there is such a good vibe there and loads to do. The room had free wi-fi which is really good too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, good price!”
Reviews.Author: ChcgoGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here under the recommendation of his parents, and we are glad we did! It is a very nice hotel. The front desk staff are very helpful, seemed sincere in their hope that we enjoyed our stay and made us feel welcome immediately. We requested a room on the upper level with a view of the mountains and we got it. Yes, the 101 Freeway is right there and yes, it produces quite a bit of noise, so if that bothers you, request a room away from that-however that is not the fault of the hotel nor did it bother us. The restaurant on-site is called Tula's and they have delicious breakfasts though it is a bit overpriced. This hotel is very close to Universal Studios (to which they provide free shuttle service) and the Hollywood Walk of Fame, plus it's easy accessibility to the 101 made traveling to and from the hotel a snap. The price is what you'd expect from a Holiday Inn. All in all, a great hotel with an extremely pleasant staff in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kiwiboz1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of hotels in the US and when you are travelling by yourself you sure find out exactly what they are like. I wrote to this hotel before I went to ask if it was safe for a single woman traveller â€“ had a really friendly helpful reply and that set the scene. The room was very comfortable with an excellent bed and very quiet despite being by the freeway. The staff were the most friendly and helpful I have ever come across and the Bellhop anticipated when I needed help with m bags. I had a fantastic two days and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. I am sure going back there next time Iâ€™m in LA. Loved the proximity to Universal Studios and the free shuttles. Nice pool. Only little problem was that the gift shop seemed to be closed a lot. This has become my favourite US hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Angela71362_8
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here and found it to be in the perfect location. We flew into LAX and it was a 25 min. drive. We were 3 minutes from Universal Studios, 15 minutes from the beautiful Santa Monica Beach, and 15 minutes from Hollywood Blvd. Walk of Fame. It was clean and the staff were great! We would defilnitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: JMH79
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and in great condition. The staff was nice and helpful. The location was great for visiting Universal Studios or Burbank and was only 15 min from Hollywood. It was great to be so close to the main freeways in order to get across town. Looked like it had a great pool and fitness center as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean and brilliantly located hotel, with very helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jedi84
Reviews.Content: A friend and myself stayed at this hotel for a week starting 8th May. We didnt hire a car whilst we were in LA. The best part of the hotel for my friend and I was how helpful the staff were, especially in the gift shop. Because we hadnt hired a car we were having to rely on public transport. The ladies in the gift shop knew absolutely everything about bus and metro routes throughout the city and if they didnt know them, they would find out for us. This made getting around LA a lot easier. We also decided we would visit Disneyland whilst in LA and we organised that through the shop also. They also arranged our transport from the hotel to the airport when it was time for us to leave. The hotel restaurant served excellent food and the staff in there were very pleasant. We ate most of our meals at the hotel restaurant on an evening. We did have two breakfasts at the hotel also. The breakfast was a little overpriced however. The hotel rooms were kept lovely and clean and were very spacious. The beds were also extremly comfortable. Although our air conditioning unit in our room was a little tempramental so it did get a little warm in the room on an evening. There was no safe in the hotel room though, so we didnt really have anywhere to store our valuables during the day whilst we were out. The hotel pool was nice and relaxed, although there was still some building work going on at the pool during our stay. All in all a very enjoyable stay and I would definately stay here again and most definately recommend this hotel to anyone considering a visit to LA!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelwithkids_9
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be clean and nice. Staff was friendly and the servers in the restaurant were always a blast and very friendly. Definitely get a room overlooking the tennis courts as it is right beside the 101 freeway and it can be very noisy. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “No frills... but fine for a night!”
Reviews.Author: takeme2mybeach
Reviews.Content: We spent the final night of our US roadtrip here before flying back to London and we weren't disappointed. Great breakfast... a pool to chill out... central for shopping and Universal. Rooms are fairly basic, but request one overlooking the tennis courts as I believe they are quieter than on the other side of the hotel. Not plush... but clean and good value for a night stop over.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: butlydog
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights middle of April, changed room 4 times. Nice rooms but the noise from the freeway was incredible, ask for one facing tennis courts. Staff very nice and nothing too much trouble for them. Breakfast buffet was good food at resonable prices. The pool area was being worked on even though it was supposed to be up and running before we ot there. If going to L A again would try somewhere else. They charge you to park your car.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, ideal place!”
Reviews.Author: jenzyNorthwestUK
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here for 3 nights. Our first impressions were O dear - what have we done! As we settled into our fist night and familiarised ourselves with the hotel we were quite pleased. There was a lovely cafe / restaurant a little pricey but very nice and ideal for the time we were there. On site also was a gift shop where there was a very friendly attendant who very honestly helped us choose the right tour to do, we also booked our Universal Studios tour - which we were very pleased with, as you got 2 days for the price of 1!! well worth doing as you can't really do everything in one day! The hotel is not too far from places you are likely to visit. There is the Metro stystem you can use to get about which is the cheapest and quickest way to get about LA. We got the Hotel free Shuttle service to Universal studios which was great they are very accomodating the staff here at Beverly Garland and we found they were very polite and always willing to help you in anyway possible . I would reccomend this hotel if you are only in LA for a few days as there really is not much to do in the initial surrounding area. Great service throughout and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Great place Stay for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Wu_Oolong
Reviews.Content: I just reached this hotel yesterday afternoon and I like it. It has a nice cosy feel to the whole hotel, from the staff to the facilities. The reception staff who welcomed us was very polite and unpretentious, and the staff who led us to our block was warm and friendly too. The room was clean, except for a few hair strands on the bathroom floor. we stayed in the room with two queen size beds. beds were clean and sheets spotless. hot shower/bath was available and didn't had to wait too long for the heater to work. there was wireless access, which was fabulous, coffee brewer and ice box in the room. too bad there wasn't a hot water boiler and in-room security box, though they have security boxes at the reception. Lots of sockets if you have multiple people using the laptops or just charging batteries. Pool is under renovation which is okay with us, because it's damn windy here (about 15 degrees C average. had a great sleep as it was nicely located 10 minutes away from Hollywood blvd area. they also have a pick-up at several timings, back and fro to Universal studios lastly. again on the wonderful staff here -- My friend lost her cell phone and the recep staff readily help her with getting the contact number to the transport we took (supershuttle). All in all, Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great room, close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: kiwideni
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Beverly Garland for a couple nights while visiting Universal Studios. We arrived early in the morning off a 14hour flight from NZ and the staff made the check in process so easy! Very close to Universal studios and close to the shops and restaurants. Breakfast in the restaurant was delicious and staff were very attentitive. Reception staff even organised private transport to our next hotel in Anaheim. A very pleasant stay and will be coming back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the kids suite”
Reviews.Author: jaxonaah
Reviews.Content: My five year old had a great time in the kids suite with bunk beds and his own TV. It is not a separate room though, just a 3/4 wall. The hotel has a good restaurant and the friendly front desk staff gave us a ton of kids eat free coupons to use there which was helpful. The free shuttle to citywalk/universal was perfect for us but I wish they had a couple of later pickups (last one 8:15pm). The hotel is older, and some features seem outdated, but overall a great value, central location, and a fun stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation and location”
Reviews.Author: dasu16
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this great hotel. We booked it after reading the reviews and were not disappointed. There was construction work taking place and the pool was out of action but it caused no problems or disturbance. We were upgraded to an executve room-it was spacious and very quiet. The staff were very helpful and we were able to buy tickets to universal studios at the same price as on the internet ( a better deal than buying it at the venue as we got a second day free) We had 3 meals at the restaurant and found the food excellent and were surprised at how cheap it was considering the poor exchange rate to the pound at the moment. The hotel transfer bus was very useful- we were given a schedule and the bus driver was willing to drop us at the metro station as well as the studio- he even aranged different pick up points for people when asked. We took the super shuttle from LAX but would not recommend it as the standard of driving was poor and it took an hour ( they go twice round the airport and stop at each of the 7 terminals before starting the journey) We returned by taxi and although an extra $15 it was a much better experience and only took 25 mins. If we returned to Hollywood we would certainly stay here agian.

Reviews.Title: “Would never return”
Reviews.Author: teacherTacoma
Reviews.Content: We were stuck in a hotel UNDER CONSTRUCTION and NO POOL /NO JUCUZZI or ANYTHING for kids to do. The website shows pictures that completely misrepresent the place. Who wants to drag suitcases over and around construction site cones?! The front desk employees were reluctant to answer our questions, and the shuttle left us at CityWalk and we had to wait a half hour in the freezing rain. The housekeeper was in our room every day at 4pm when most people were returning from a day out--- causing us to stand in the hallway and wait. If it were not for the two ADORABLE waiters at the HUGELY OVERPRICED restaurant, our trip would have been a complete loss. In case you have not guessed, this is not a place I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for exploring L.A.”
Reviews.Author: MatRJ
